Wiliam values the loan he will obtain through this method and he is committed to complete the repayments of the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He is seeking this loan to reinvest in his business of buying and selling sticks and wood

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es:
Zuleima V. de 23 años es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Jardín de Rosas, ella vende CDs, en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto de lunes a viernes  de 8:00am a 18:00pm tiene su propio lugar de venta, Zulema necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.
Las demás integrantes tienen variados negocios como la venta de material escolar, utensilios de limpieza, condimentos, ropa, atención de tienda de barrio, producción de muebles y otros.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Panamericana.
texts.en:
Zuleima V. is 23 years old, she is a member of the communal borrowing group Jardín de Rosas [Garden of Roses]. She sells CDs in La Ceja neighborhood in the city El Alto from Monday to Friday 8:00 am- 6:00 pm. She has her own place for sales. Zulema needs the loan to buy merchandise. The rest of the members have various businesses, like the sale of school supplies, cleaning utensils, condiments, clothes, attending a shop, furniture production and others. They all need the loan to acquire merchandise, ingredients or primary materials. They meet every two weeks at the Centro Focal Panamericana.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad, la socia está separada del marido, ella vive con su nietito de 4 años de edad y lo cuida y quiere mucho; La socia se hizo cargo de su nieto a raíz de una incompatibilidad entre los padres del menor, la socia se dedica a la venta de productos secos, ella también tiene terrenos de cultivos, los mismos que sirven para ella extraer maíz y habas, pallares y los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado central de Urcos su tierra natal; Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas y sembrar en sus terrenos.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Las Amistosas” (Friendly Ladies) communal bank. She is a native of the Urcos district, in the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department; located one hour from the city of Cusco. Our associate is 52 years old, is separated from her husband and lives with her four-year old grandson, whom she cares for and loves very much. She became her grandson’s caregiver because his parents were not fit. [Felicitas] sells dry goods. She also has her own farmland where she raises corn and beans and sells most of the harvest in the Urcos central market. She is requesting this loan in order to buy seeds with so that she can plant on her land. She is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seeds for planting

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
La socia Balvina; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19, 15 años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio ella junto a su pareja, se dedican a la producción y venta de pan,  y al engorde de ganados, La socia compra en la feria la tablada ganados cada cierto tiempo y los cría y engorda después según el tamaño de los mismos los vende o los hace aparear para incrementar sus ganados; La socia solicita el préstamo como parte de capital para comprar un ganadito.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Balvina is a member of the "Las Amistosas" (Friendly Women) village bank. She is from the Urcos District in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco, an hour away from the city of Cusco. Balvina is forty-eight-years-old, and has a common law husband and three children, twenty-one, nineteen, and fifteen-years-old. She alternates her home and business duties. She and her husband earn their living making and selling bread, as well as raising cattle. She periodically buys cattle at the fair, raises them, and fattens them up according to their size. Then she either sells them or breeds them to increase their numbers. Balvina is requesting a loan to use as partial capital to buy a young cow. She appreciates and values the loan and promises to pay it back on time and in full.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is seeking a loan as partial capital to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 52 años, madre D. cuatro 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 18 años venD. golosinas, en donD. su público objetivo son los niños, escolares la gran mayoría, puesto que venD. cerca D. una escuela. Aprovechando los horarios D. recreo y D. salida, no se da abasto para atender varios niños, es por ello que recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos, además la apoyan cuando necesite comprar alguna mercadería y necesita transportarla hasta su casa.  Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que lo productos que venD. tiene mucha demanda. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ventas, así como su carreta D. golosinas para poder abastecerse D. más mercadería. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que valoran mucho la amistad, además asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. golosinas, como: cajas D. galletas D. diferentes sabores, caramelos, chupetines, refrescos, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old, the mother of 4 children, and together, they live in her own house. For around 18 years she has sold treats and her customers are children, the great majority students, since she sells near a school. She benefits from the students' recreational and departure times but is unable to buy merchandise to serve all the various children and has to rely on assistance from her own children for both merchandise and transportation to and from her home. The business is very profitable due to high demand for the products. Her major hope is to increase sales, and to supply her cart of treats with more merchandise. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She is very content to belong to her communal group, since she places high value on friendship, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. The loan she solicits will be used for buying wholesale treats, such as packages of cookies of different flavors, caramels, and lollipops, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TREATS TO SELL

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista ella vende en un stand de desayunos ambulantes, mates de todo tipo medicinales (mates de cebada, de cola de caballo, de hinojo, de manzanilla, y así de todas las plantas, hierbas medicinales naturales). Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para volver a comprar los insumos y servicios necesarios para su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Las Amistosas" (Friendly Women) village bank. She is a native of the Urcos District, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco, one hour from the city of Cusco. Our member is twenty-seven-years-old, lives with her partner and has two children. She goes between her personal life and and her retail business activities. She has a cart where she sells breakfast as well as medicinal infusions (made from barley, horse tail, fennel, chamomile, and all sorts of other plants, herbs, and natural medicines). Juana is seeking a loan to pay for more goods and services for her business. She appreciates and values the loan, and promises to make all her payments in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is seeking a loan to buy more goods and services she needs for her business.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 29 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad,  nuestra socia trabaja en la municipalidad de limpieza y vende comida, la socia también vende ropa de manera ambulatoria ella trae de Lima y de Juliaca y vende casa por casa a sus amigas y conocidos, la socia da en dos partes la facilidad de pago, ella también lava ropa los fines de semana va a las casa que solicita su servicio y lava la ropa, Nuestra socia es una mujer independiente y sumamente trabajadora, Ella solicita el préstamo para viajar a traer más ropa de temporada otoño e invierno.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the “Las Amistosas” communal bank. She is a native of the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. This is about one hour from the city of Cusco. Cirila is 29 years old, lives with a partner, and has two children, 4 and 2 years of age. She works as a cleaning person for the city, and also sells food. She also travels to Lima and Juliacea to buy clothing that she sells door-to-door to her friends and acquaintances. She also offers laundry service in people’s homes on weekends. She is an independent and very hardworking woman. Cirila will use this loan to travel to purchase more clothing to sell for the fall and winter seasons. She appreciates and values this loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio Nicanor, pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Nuestro socio tiene 57 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19, 15 años de edad; Nuestro socio se dedica al engorde de ganados y a la elaboración y venta de pan y también trabaja por comisiones en una empresa de transporte vendiendo boletos, El socio solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios como es el la compra de un ganado y los insumos de la elaboración de pan.
 
Nuestro socio valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Nicanor is a member of the “Las Amistosas” comunal bank. He is a native of the Urcos district, in the province of Quispicanchis, in the Cusco department, located one hour from the city of Cusco. Our associate is 57 years old, is married and has three children, ages 21, 19, and 15. He specializes in raising livestock and also makes and sells bread. He also works selling tickets on commission for a transportation company. He is asking for this loan in order to reinvest into his various businesses. He values this loan very much and promises to make his payments according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio Carlos, pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Nuestro socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 7, 6, 3 años de edad; Nuestro socio se dedica a prestar servicio de moto taxis, el también tiene terrenos cultivados con maíz, papa, habas, su conyugue es ama de casa y también se dedica a la venta de granos secos, ella vende en el mercado de Urcos los granos y ahora quiere vender comida en el mercado, para lo cual Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para su conyugue, con este dinero comprarán algunos ingredientes y ollas y cocinita a primus (utiliza kerosene).  

Nuestro socio valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Carlos belongs to the “Las Amistosas” communal bank. He is a native of the Urcos district in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. This is about one hour from the city of Cusco. Carlos is 32 years old, lives with a partner, and has three daughters aged 7, 6, and 3. He is in the moto-taxi business. He also farm land and grows corn, potatoes, and beans. His partner takes care of their home and also sells dry grains in the Urcos market. Now she wants to sell food in the market, so he is requesting this loan so that she can buy some ingredients, pots and a small kerosene stove. Carlos appreciates this loan and promises to complete his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his partner to set up a food stand

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La socia Inocencia, pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 20, 19 años de edad; Nuestra socia se dedica a  la venta de pan, al por mayor y menor, ella también tiene 2 topos de terrenos, nuestra socia tiene a sus dos hijos estudiando en la universidad nacional en Cusco, por lo que ella trabaja duro para enviarles el dinero mensual para el alquiler de sus cuartos, alimentos, ropa y sus útiles universitarios. Nuestra  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan.

Nuestra socia valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a member of the ”Las Amistosas” communal bank. She is a native of the Urcos district, in the Quispicanchis province, in the Cusco department, located one hour from the city of Cusco. She is 43 years old, married and has three children, ages 24, 20, and 19. She sells bread in large and small quantities and also has two small plots of land. Her two sons study at Cusco National University and she works hard in order to be able to send them money each month, so that they can pay for their rooms, clothing and school supplies. Our associate is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients for baking bread. She values this loan and promises to repay according to the terms.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Milena Margarita

texts.es:
Milena Margarita O. Guzmán tiene 24 años y vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 3 años,  en el  populoso barrio El Bosque, uno de los más extensos de Barranquilla  y está ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad, con una población de 50 mil habitantes.   Milena comenzó su negocio  de venta de perfumes, ropa, calzado, cosméticos, mediante guía especializadas de productos y de manera independiente hace 5 años, ante la necesidad de generar ingresos propios, con lo que pidió dinero prestado a un familiar y debido a que es muy organizada su actividad creció a través del tiempo y ahora solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000, que invertirá en la compra de calzado y ropa femenina y masculino, también en productos que exhibe en su catálogo como accesorios femeninos e infantiles y perfumes. 
Está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace más de un año, en el que ha aprovechado muy bien  su  financiamiento,  pues logró  aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus utilidades,  y con ello su acceso  a nuevos bienes y servicios;  de esa manera  ha mejorado su nivel de vida.
Su meta principal es destacar su negocio teniendo una infraestructura  que le permita exhibir los productos que vende, es decir crear su propio punto de venta. Su sueño es que su pequeño hijo tenga la mejor educación posible y está trabajando para ello; ahora el mayor desafió de Milena es el otorgamiento de créditos de fácil recuperación, porque con algunos  clientes ha tenido que llenarse de paciencia y renegociar su deuda, por eso ahora está más atenta a su mercado de trabajo.
texts.en:
Milena Margarita is 24 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in the populous El Bosque neighborhood, one of the most extensive in Barranquilla. It is located in the south-east part of the city and has a population of 50 million. Milena began her business of selling perfumes, clothing, shoes, and cosmetics five years ago because she needed to earn her own income. She got a loan from her family and since she is well organized, was able to grow her business over time. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 COP ($1,050) in order to invest in shoes, men’s and women’s clothing, and other items that she features in her catalog, such as children’s and ladies accessories and perfumes. She’s been working with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the past year, where she has made good use of her loan. She was able to increase her working capital and its usefulness, which gave her access to new services. This enabled her to improve her quality of life. Her primary goal is to make her business stand out by creating an infrastructure that will allow her to showcase her products. In other words, she would like to have her own point of sale. Her dream is that her young son gets the best education possible and she is working toward that. Now her only challenge is collecting the money that some of her customers owe her, because some have not kept up with their payments and she has had to be patient and renegotiate their debts. This is why she is so attentive to her market.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Naysha Dilan

texts.es:
La socia Naysha; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar como hija con el comercio minorista;  Nuestra socia estudia en la universidad particular obstetricia y en su tiempo libre ayuda  en el negocio de su a mamá, su mamá vive en Puerto Maldonado, ella vende verduras y su hija le envía verduras fresas en camiones a Puerto Maldonado, ellas tienen terrenos de cultivos de zanahorias, tomate, cebolla y algunas frutas, ambas trabajan mutuamente y con un buen ritmo, está socia inicialmente entró al banco en representación de su mamá, pero ahora es titular y saca su propio capital de trabajo para continuar con el negocio de la familia.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Naysha belongs to a communal bank called “LAS AMISTOSAS” ("The Friendly Women"). She comes from the district of Urcos, in Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco, located 1 hour from the city of Cusco. She is 19 years old and single. She divides her time between her household chores and working with her mother in her retail business. She is also studying obstetrics at a private university. Her mother lives in Puerto Maldonado and sells vegetables. Her daughter sends her fresh vegetables in trucks to Puerto Maldonado. They have farmlands planted with carrots, tomatoes, onions and some kinds of fruits. Both of them work in harmony and help each other. Naysha first joined the bank as a representative of her mother, but now she has her own account and is receiving her own working capital to continue with the family business. Naysha values and appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito D. Urcos, en la provincia D. Quispicanchis y departamento D. Cusco; situado a 1 hora desD. la ciudad D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 9 hijos, la socia vive actualmente con sus 2  hijos, Nuestra socia se dedica al cultivo D. papa, y también cría gallinas y cuyes, nuestra socia cría estas aves D. corral y cuyes para incrementar su producción, luego la socia los venD. y algunas veces le sirve D. para elaborar comidas para la venta en su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank; she is from Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department, which is an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is 52 years old, widowed and has 9 children; she currently lives with two of her children. She is a potato farmer but also raises chickens and guinea pigs to increase her production; she sells them sometimes and other times she uses them as ingredients for the meals she sells. Juana is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Hayde; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 4, 3 meses;  nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista ella vende comida en el colegio M. Santos, por las tardes y por las mañanas en la plaza central, y los domingos vende gallinas y cuyes  Nuestra socia es una mujer muy trabajadora como muchas mujeres en nuestro país, ellas creen que los varones en cualquier momento se podrían ir a casa y ellas asumir plenamente la responsabilidad que implica ser madre y padre. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en sus diferentes negocios.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Hayde belongs to the "Las Amistosas" (Friendly Women) village bank. She comes from the Urcos District in the Province of Quispicanchis, Department of Cusco, an hour from the city of Cusco. Hayde is thirty-one, and has a common law husband and four children, who are 12, 10, 4, and 3 months. She alternates between personal and retail business activities. She sells food at the M. Santos school during the afternoon, and at the central plaza in the mornings. Sundays she sells chickens and guinea pigs. Our member is a very hard-working woman, like a lot of women in our country, who believe that it ought to be possible for the men to go home at at a moment's notice, and the women to completely take on the responsibilities required of both mother and father. Hayde is a very grateful member and values the loan, promising to pay it back in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our member is requesting a loan to invest in her various businesses.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Victoria es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Victoria compra cereales en las diferentes ferias de la región y los vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Victoria viaja a la ciudad de Lima en donde vende cereales y papa.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Los sueños de Victoria son educar a sus hijos y capital propio.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of Virgen Maria (Virgin Mary) communal bank. Victoria, 45, is married and has 5 children. She buys cereals in the various regional farmers markets and sells them in marked in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Victoria goes all the way to the city of Lima to sell cereals and potato. Victoria needs a 2000 sol loan to buy potatoes. Her dreams are to educate her children and to have her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
La socia Braulia; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos de 28, 26, 16, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades con el comercio minorista Nuestra socia vende chicha diario en su casa por las tardes, a parte ella tiene un auto que lo alquila y le pagan a diario por el alquiler de todo un día de su auto para que lo trabajen como taxi; la socia también vende caldo de gallina en la tablada los domingos, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia Braulia; pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”, es natural del distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco; situado a 1 hora desde la ciudad de Cusco. Braulia, 46, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank. She is from Urcos, Quispicanchis province, Cusco department, which is an hour away from the city of Cusco. She is a widow and has three children who are 28, 26 and 16 years of age. She combines her household chores with retail commerce. She sells chicha (alcoholic drink made from fermented maize) from home every afternoon. In addition, she has a car that she leases out for taxi service for a daily rental fee. Also, she sells chicken soup in La Tablada on Sundays. She is asking for funding to buy chickens. She is grateful for and values the loan and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Lucinda Emilia

texts.es:
Lucinda es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Lucinda es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, vive en Minas CanA., Lucinda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además vende salchipapas por las noches.
Lucinda necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Lucinda son comprar una congeladora para su tienda y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucinda is a member of the Virgin Mary Community Bank. She is married, 40 years old, and has three children. She lives in Minas CanA.. Lucinda has a stO. in her house selling general groceries, vegetables, meat, as well as salchipapas (fried potatoes and sausages) in the evenings. She needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy rice and sugar. Lucinda's dreams are to buy a freezer for the stO. and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly tiene 31 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores D. edad, vive junto a su familia en el caserío Quemazón, una zona rural ubicada en el distrito D. Mórrope, D. la provincia D. Lambayeque, a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a la crianza D. animales en su domicilio, actualmente ella cría ganado vacuno, ovino y caprino en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior D. su vivienda. Ella cría sus animales y cuando ya están completamente desarrollados los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia. Esta actividad le brinda D. ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento D. su familia ya que las ganancias que su esposo percibe como agricultor no son suficientes para salir adelante.

Adicionalmente ella también ha instalado una pequeña bodega en su vivienda hace cuatro años, el negocio fue instalado gracias a algunos ahorros que tenía disponibles y poco a poco ha hecho crecer su establecimiento, estas actividades contituyen un importante ingreso extra para la economia D. su familia.

Magaly desea ampliar su negocio D. venta D. animales con la compra D. aves y alimentos para que estas se desarrollen adecuadamente, asimismo desea ampliar su bodega con la compra D. algunos artículos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Magaly es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarles una buena calidad D. vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
31-year old Magaly is married and has two children. She and her family live in the village of Quemazón, a rural area located in Mórrope district, Lambayeque province, an hour from the town of Chiclayo. For the last ten years Magaly has raised animals in her home. At the moment she is raising cattle, sheep, and goats in an area located in the back of her house. Once the animals are grown, she sells them to the businessmen who frequently visit the neighbourhood. This work brings in income to help support the family as her husband's wages as a farmer aren't sufficient for them to get ahead. Magdaly has also run a small grocery store from her home for the last four years. She started it with some available savings and gradually expanded the business which provides important additional income for the family. Magdaly wishes to expand the animal-raising siD. of her work by buying poultry and feed so that the birds develop properly. She also wants to expand her grocery store by buying additional items. As a result she approached Edpyme Alternativa and asked for a loan of 1500 soles to help her achieve her objective. She is a hardworking woman and devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to be able to proviD. them with a good quality of life. She has already had a loan with our institution and immediately demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with the repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Marina es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Marina se dedica a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos y también en terrenos alquilados, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de semillas.
Marina sueña con construir el segundo piso de su casa y una computadora para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Marina, 34, is married and has 4 children; she farms vegetables on her own and on leased farmlands; she sells her product in the city’s food wholesale market. Marina needs a 2000 sol loan to buy seed. Her dream is to build a second floor on her house and a computer for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy a "Caldo de Gallina" awning, a bench, and a large table

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Miriam tiene una cebichería en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 5 personas. Además Miriam vende pescado los días sábados y domingos.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas.
Miriam sueña con tener un local propio y sucursales.
texts.en:
Miriam, 35, is a member of the Totorilla communal bank; she lives with her life partner and their three children. She has a ‘cebichería’ (place that sells ‘ceviche,’ marinated fish cocktails) in a rented location; she has five helpers and is open for business every day. She also sells fish on weekends. Miriam needs a 2500 sol loan to buy tables. She dreams with owning her own place and branch locations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de Cinco Pinos el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como ladrillos, bloques,  laminas de zinc para cubrir el techo de su casita, ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido y su familia la ha sacado a delante.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de Cinco Pinos el crédito será destinado para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como ladrillos, bloques, laminas de zinc para cubrir el techo de su casita, ha salido adelante gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido y su familia la ha sacado a delante.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar compra de materialez de contruccion, tales como ladrillos, cemento

loans.name: Leonilda

texts.es:
Leonilda es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Leonilda es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Leonilda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas, golosinas.
Leonilda necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza.
Los sueños de Leonilda son educar a sus hijos y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonilda is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Leonilda, 40, lives with her life partner and their two children; she has a store in her house where she sells beverages and snacks. Leonilda needs a 1500 sol loan to buy beer. Her dreams are to educate her children and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer.

loans.name: Vilma Ercilia

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Vilma junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas.
Los sueños de Vilma son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Vilma, 30, lives with her life partner and their three children; she and her husband farm vegetables on their farmlands and sell their crops to the city’s food wholesale market. Vilma needs 900 soles to buy seed. Vilma’s dreams are to provide a good education for her children and to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Judith Eudocia

texts.es:
Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Judith es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Judith se dedica a la siembra de alfalfa en sus terrenos y también alquilados, producto que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Judith junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte publico.
Judith necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para el pago de alquiler de terreno.
Judith sueña con tener casa propia y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Judith, 31, lives with her life partner and their child. She farms alfalfa on her own and on leased lands and sells her crop in Ayacucho’s food wholesale market. In addition, Judith and her husband have a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he provides public transportation services. Judith needs 900 soles to pay for land rental fees. Judith dreams with owning her own home and providing a good education to her child.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for land rental.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Delfina es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Delfina junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de verduras en sus terrenos, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas.
El sueño de Delfina son construir su casa.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Totorilla communal bank. Delfina, 23, lives with her life partner and their two children. She and her husband farm vegetables on their farmlands and sell their crops to the city’s wholesale food market. Delfina needs 1250 soles to buy seed. Her dream is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Edis

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para la compra de cemento, bloques y laminas de zinc, ya que tendrá todos los materiales y asi su familia vivirá dignamente en su casita.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para la compra de cemento, bloques y laminas de zinc, ya que tendrá todos los materiales y asi su familia vivirá dignamente en su casita.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez, talez como bloques, cemento, arena

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo S. P. oriundo de  Bucaramanga, llamada también la ciudad de los parques, es un gran emprendedor que a sus 61 años vive en el barrio Granada de Malambo, municipio del área Metropolitana de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la fabricación de calzado como muchos de sus vecinos en el sector que fabrican zapatos, sandalias deportivas y que en su mayoría venden a pequeños almacenes.Gustavo conoció de la Fundación Santo Domingo porque dos de sus vecinos viven muy cerca y son clientes de esta organización; allí está solicitando  un crédito  por valor de $1.500.000 que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como 500 pares de plantillas, 50 metros de sintético  de capellada e insumos como pegantes e hilos.
Gustavo aprendió este oficio, tradición familiar, precisamente en el taller de su padre cuando apenas culminaba el bachillerato y a los 21 años después de haber trabajado un año en una empresa también de calzado, montó con la liquidación su propio negocio; empezó con una máquina, un motor y 12 hornos y  un año mas tarde se fue a vivir a Venezuela  donde trabajó en su propia empresa  donde llegó a tener 45  operarios.  La situación se complicó  y la crisis en el país vecino se agudizó,  por lo que tuvo que cerrar la fábrica e irse a vivir a Mérida donde empezó a trabajar el calzado sobre medida. En el año 1977 decidió regresar a Colombia e instalarse en Malambo cerca de su familia, organizò su taller con 3 empleados y hoy está en proceso de expansión ya que su experiencia y la calidad de sus productos les han permitido comenzar a trabajar con almacenes que comercializan calzado reconocidos en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Él espera posicionarse en el mercado con las grandes cadenas de almacenes por eso ha legalizado su negocio. Sus desafíos mas importantes  fueron las crisis que vivió con la recesión de Venezuela, pero él siempre esta dispuesto a seguir luchando y volver a comenzar como hasta el momento lo ha hecho en la población de Malambo.
texts.en:
Gustavo S. P., 61, originally from Bucaramanga, also known as the city of parks, is a great entrepreneur who lives in the Granada de Malambo neighborhood, part of Barranquilla’s metropolitan area. He is a cobbler, as are many of his neighbors in this area, who manufacture shoes and sports sandals which are then sold in small stores. Gustavo became aware of the Fundación Santo Domingo through two close neighbors who are clients. He is asking for funding in the amount of $1.500.000 to buy materials and supplies like: 500 pairs of insoles, 50 meters of synthetic shoe leather and supplies such as adhesives and thread. Gustavo learned this skill, a family tradition, precisely in his father’s workshop when he was about to finish high school. When he turned 21, after having worked for a year in a shoe manufacturing firm, he used is severance pay to set up his own business. He started out with just one motor and 12 shoe molds. A year later, he moved to Venezuela to run his own firm where he grew to have 45 employees. The situation became complicated and the crisis in the neighboring country became acute to such an extent that he had to close his factory and move to the city of Mérida where he began to make custom order shoes. In 1977 he returned to Colombia and settled in Malambo near his family; he set up a workshop with three employees and he’s now in the process of expanding because his experience and the quality of his products has made it possible for him to start collaborating with large, well-known shoe stores in Barranquilla. He hopes to position himself with the large chain department stores so he has all the legal permits for his business. His greatest challenge was facing the crisis the recession in Venezuela produced but he has always been prepared to continue fighting to get ahead in life and to start over again as he’s now doing in Malambo.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cobbler's materials and supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de 3 vacas paridas, y de esta manera mejorar su hato ganadero
texts.en:
Este cliente es originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para compra de 3 vacas paridas, y de esta manera mejorar su hato ganadero

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de vacas paridas

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín es un padre de familia de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que queda ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y productos de consumo diario en una bodega instalada en un ambiente de su domicilio. El negocio constituye una fuente importante de ingresos económicos familiares, adicionalmente Martín también posee una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros)  con la que trabaja cubriendo rutas dentro de la zona.

Martín desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos de manera que puedan captar mas ingresos que les permitan obtener una mejor calidad de vida, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es un padre bastante responsable y entregado a su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora estos ya han formado sus propias familias, eso lo llena de emoción y orgullo. Su más grande anhelo es tener la fuerza y salud necesarias para poder disfrutar plenamente los años de vida que le quedan junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Martín is a 60 year old family man. He lives with his wife in the Santa Rosa district, an area that is primarily economically dependent upon fishing. It is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over five years he has been selling basic needs items, groceries, and daily consumption products in a grocery store, which he has set up in an area in his home. The business is an important source of income for his family. Martín also has a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). He works with his mototaxi and covers routes within the region. Martín wants to expand his grocery store by purchasing more products. This way he will be able to get more income, which will allow them to have a better quality of life. That is why he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 2,000 PEN to help him achieve his objective. He is a very responsible father, and he is devoted to his family. With much effort he has known how to get his children ahead. Now, they have formed their own families. This fills him with emotion and pride. His greatest desire is to have the strength and health necessary to be able to fully enjoy the years of life he has left together with his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to expand his business

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva tiene 59 años, separada, pero de aquel compromiso tiene dos hijas, una de ellas trabaja en la ciudad, por lo que solo vive con su segunda hija en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 5 años vende mazamorra (dulce típico peruano), pero hace 3 años, que se estableció en un puesto de venta. Su actividad empieza desde la mañana hasta la tarde, y de lo que resta del día se limita a comprar lo necesario para elaborar por la mañana su postre. Por la calidad y buen gusto con que prepara la mazamorra, ha hecho que merezca el reconocimiento de sus clientes, y eso le ha favorecido mucho en las ventas y por ende en sus ganancias. Por lo pronto se proyecta en preparar más mazamorra para aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes necesarios  para la preparación de  mazamorras.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 59, is separated and has two daughters. One of her daughters lives and works in the city so Genoveva lives in her own house with just her second daughter. She’s been selling mazamorra (a typical Peruvian sweet) for five years but it was only three years ago that she got her own sales stand. She is open for business from morning to afternoon; she uses the rest of the day to shop for her ingredients for the next day’s dessert production. Thanks to the good quality and delicious taste of her preparation, she has become very well known among her customers so sales have been good and income has increased. This is her 13th loan with MFP and she assures that she will repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she considers the help she will get to be very useful for her business’s progress. She will use the requested funds to buy necessary ingredients for her mazamorras.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 34 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años, vende frutas en un puesto de venta que se encuentra cerca de su casa.  Es así que se levanta muy temprano para comprar frutas, logrando obtener variedad de ellas, y eso le da mucha ventaja en la venta. Su trabajo es de todos los días, y solo logra descansar por las tardes, lo que más le gusta de esta actividad es que este negocio le permite tener tiempo para dedicarse a su hogar. Con el tiempo anhela adquirir un puesto más y de esa manera ampliar el espacio de su puesto de venta. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más frutas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 34 years old, and she lives with her three children in her own house. For six years she has been selling fruit at a stand, which is near her house. She gets up very early to buy the fruit. She gets a variety of fruit, and this gives her a big sales advantage. She works everyday, and she is only able to rest in the afternoons. What she likes best about this activity is that this business allows her to have time to spend on her house. In time she wishes to get another stand. That way she will expand her selling space. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She guarantees that she will be very responsible with her payments. She feels that this support will be very helpful in the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to buy more fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fruits

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es: Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para mejorar su vivienda, para comprar materiales de construcción, tales como bloques, bolsas de cemento, ladrillos, laminas de zinc, ha salido adelante con el crédito que ha obtenido, para vivir dignamente en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Este cliente es originaria del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, el crédito será destinado para mejorar su vivienda, para comprar materiales de construcción, tales como bloques, bolsas de cemento, ladrillos, laminas de zinc, ha salido adelante con el crédito que ha obtenido, para vivir dignamente en su vivienda.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez de contruccion

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 8 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 8 años se dedica a la costura, en donD. ofrece a su clientela la confección D. ropa D. niños, como: buzos, casacas en material polar. Su actividad empieza desD. la mañana, acompañándola su única herramienta D. trabajo, que es su maquina D. coser. Hay momentos en que sus hijos mayores la ayudan en la confección, así como en la venta D. la ropa que confecciona. Las ganancias que percibe le ayudan a sostener a su familia y eso la mantiene tranquila. Su deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener un taller D. costura con nuevos equipos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, menciona además que dicho aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. fardos D. tela , hilos y demás implementos para  elaborar sus prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Dora, 45, lives with her husband and 8 children in her own home. She has been a seamstress for the last 8 years; she manufactures clothing for children, especially thermal sweatshirts and jackets. Her only work tool is her sewing machine which is her only company during her work day that starts early in the morning. Occasionally, her older children help her to make and sell her wares. Her profits help her support her family and that gives her much peace of mind. She would love to have her business grow and have a workshop equipped with newer equipment. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be very punctual with her repayments and she also mentioned that the loan will be very useful for her business’s progress. She will use the funds to buy bolts of fabric, threads and other dressmaking tools.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia de 45 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos en el sector Los Algarrobos del distrito de Mosefú, también conocida como La Ciudad de las Flores, es una zona con fama nacional por sus festividades turisticas y religiosas y se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de flores en los exteriores del cementerio de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, este negocio es realizado durante los fines de semana, que es cuando el camposanto recibe un mayor número de visitantes. Esta actividad constituye una fuente importante de ayuda a la economía familiar ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le brinda ingresos de manera permanente.

Hace algunos meses Mercedes adquirió con mucho esfuerzo una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que perciben ingresos adicionales, el vehículo es conducido por su hijo que recorre la ciudad de Monsefú y sus caseríos aledaños brindando su servicio.

El continuo uso brindado a la unidad y el estado accidentado de los caminos que unen a la ciudad de Monsefú con sus caseríos han hecho que la mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento. Además ella desea regularizar toda la documentación que le permita ofrecer el servicio dentro de la legalidad correspondiente, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de cancelar sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 45, lives with her husband and one of their children in the Los Algarrobos section of the Mosefú district. It is also known as “La Ciudad de las Flores” (The City of the Flowers). This area is famous nationally for its tourist and religious festivities. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For many years she has been selling flowers outside of the cemetery in the city of Ferreñafe. She works at this business on the week-ends because that is when there are a large number of people who visit the graveyard. This activity constitutes an important source of economic help to the family. Her husband is a farmer, and this does not produce income in a permanent way. A few months ago Mercedes, with much effort, got a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). She gets additional income from the mototaxi. The vehicle is driven by her son. He travels the city of Monsefú and the outlying rural communities offering his services. The continual usage of the vehicle and the rough state of the roads that join the city of Monsefú with its rural communities have caused the mototaxi to start to have some problems. These require urgent repair to make it operate correctly. She also wants to pay for all of the documentation that permits her to legally offer taxi services. That is why she is requesting a loan for 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her objective. Mercedes is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as a businesswoman to be able to give her family a better quality of life. She has previously worked with our institution. She has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility at the time of making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair, maintenance, and documention expenses for her mototaxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, que tiene como oficio chofer, y su último hijo que estudia, puesto que los 3 primeros hijos son  independientes. Hace 10 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un local alquilado a media hora de su casa. Desde entonces su actividad empieza desde las 7.00AM, momento en que inicia con la preparación de sus platillos. La ventaja que tiene en su establecimiento, es la afluencia del público, por situarse al costado del  terminal de buses, favoreciéndola en la venta, logrando vender todo en su totalidad, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea rentable. Por ello está feliz con lo que hace, solo que a veces no se abastece en atender sola a sus clientes, pero igual termina por complacer a todos. Gracias a la preferencia de ellos, es que pudo educar a sus hijos. En adelante dese incrementar su capital de trabajo y de ese modo mejorar su estilo de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como utensilios de cocina para agilizar su labor.
texts.en:
María, 56, is a hard-working woman; she lives in her own house with her husband, who is a driver, and her youngest son, who is a student. Her three oldest children are independent. For the last 10 years she has sold prepared food in a rented location half an hour away from home. Her work day all this time has begun at 7am when she starts to prepare her meals. An advantage that her location has is that it is alongside the bus terminal so it has much foot traffic. Her sales, therefore, are good and she sells out all her production thereby producing good profits. She enjoys her work very much, although sometimes it’s very difficult to tend to all her customers alone; still, she ends up pleasing all of them. Thanks to their patronage, she was able to provide an education for her children. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital so that she can improve her life style. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy basic ingredients as well as kitchen utensils to facilitate her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and utensils.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is from a city named Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

She is 43 years old and married. She always had a wish to get a good education but she couldn’t continue her studies after completing the 8th standard (grade) because of her mother’s bad health. Her presence became important at her house.

She got married at the age of 18 to a man whose name is J. I. who is a hawker (trader). He specifically deals with vegetables. He has been in this profession for the past six years. He purchases the vegetables from the vegetable markets and sells to the different areas on his four wheel cart. 

She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son is involved in a paint business. The next one in age to him is involved in a business sewing clothes and her youngest son is in school and reads in the 10th standard.
  
Zahida is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She has maintained a good record of repayment for the last three years. She describes herself as a hardworking lady because she has run her own grocery shop at her house for the past two years. She has a good number of customers.

She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase groceries (rice, lentils and cooking oil) to expand her grocery shop.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is a wife of M. Y. and lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a driver and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The younger son is in 12th standard. 
Sardaran has been a seamstress for the past 5 years. She can sew designer and non-designer clothes easily. She has passed on her art to her daughters too and they both help her to finish the clothing orders on time. 
Her husband is a fruit seller. He sells fruit on his four wheel cart by announcing his products in a loud voice. He sells good quality fruits which attracts more customers towards his product. He has been doing this work for the past 25 years. Sardaran is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah, (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita P. is from the village of Talakag  Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Amelita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Amelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Amelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Zoljargal is 22 years old and lives with her mother, sibling and 1-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her mother is a cook in a gold mining company. Her 1-year-old daughter stays at home with her sibling. Zoljargal operates a computer gaming center in a rental place at a local trading center. Her customers play games including Xbox and Playstation in her gaming center. She started her business in October, 2009, and her business has been becoming popular in her province. Furthermore, Zoljargal has been planning to operate movie rental business for extra income for her family. She has been working hard to stabilize and expand her business. Zoljargal is an open person and says, “I would like to study in a university and to have a profession. After that I will build financial security for my family.” She is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 362 USD) loan to purchase movies for a movie rental business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed is a 38 year old woman. She has resided in a two room brick house in a city Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
She is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. Her elder son is 18 years old and works with his father. Her elder daughter is 15 years old and reads in 10th standard. Her younger daughter is 12 years old and reads in 7th standard. 
Her husband's name is M. S.. He runs a sanitary supplies selling business. His shop is located in the market. Naheed supports him by preparing decorative embroidered clothes. She gets orders from her neighbors, and from the cloth shops as well, and generates a good income. 
She is a regular client of Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She is applying for a loan for the fourth time to purchase the sanitary supplies, such as (taps, water pipes) in bulk, to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase sanitary supplies.

loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en: Altanzul is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Elbegjargal, is 4 years old and hasn't reached school age yet. Altanzul worked as a cook in a small restaurant between 2004 and 2010. With the experience that she gained from her previous work, Altanzul opened her own cafe with her brother in 2010. The business is supported by the entire family. She started her business with a working capital of 60,000 tugrugs (~ 45 USD), and in only short time her working capital has increased to 300,000 tugrugs (~  216 USD). Since she started operating her business, her family's quality of life has improved. Altanzul is a very hard working person who has good communication skills. Altanzul says, “My dream is to one day expand my cafe into a comfortable restaurant.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~  220 USD) loan to purchase flour, rice, vegetables, and meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina S., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Blessed with four children, she makes sure that she earns well so that their family can have a better life. She sells cleaned and pre-packaged garlic and onions, which are necessary cooking ingredients in usual Filipino fare.

Agripina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She also wants to be able to enjoy a harmonious relationship with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her inventory.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin A., J.. is a 55-year-old man from the village of Olango. Benjamin is married and has 2 school-age children. To earn a living, Benjamin owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. More specifically, his main source of income is derived from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP during the harvest season.

In 2008, Benjamin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, he was able to engage in business activities and to improve his standard of living. Benjamin has successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. The previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Benjamin is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 35,000 PHP ($800), which will also be used to purchase fertilizers, including manure. Notably, this loan would be the fifth loan taken out by Benjamin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches, which cover the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To further expand his business by purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Rosevie

texts.en:
Rosevie B. is from the village of El  Salvador,  Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Rosevie is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosevie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosevie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosevie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Rosevie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosevie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosevie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Labi, Digkilaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Batdulam

texts.en: Batdulam is 40 years old and lives with her daughter and parents in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for nine years. Batdulam is planning to live separately from her parents (but with her daughter) in the future. Currently, she operates a second hand products trading  business. She started her business in 2004, and initially she sold her products at a rental counter. In October, 2009 she purchased a shipping container for her business with capacity of 20 tons at a local market. Batdulam usually sells second hand shoes from Germany to her many customers. Her working capital is 4,000,000 tugrugs (~  2890 USD). She has been planning to keep stabilizing her business, since it is more comfortable for her to operate the business from her own shipping container, which is her workplace. Batdulam is focused on the future and says, “I would like to purchase my own plot of land with a house and yard for me and my daughter in the future.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1445 USD) loan to purchase four large packages of used shoes for her business. The cost of the shoes per package is 300,000 – 500,000 tugrugs (~ 215 – 360 USD).

loans.use: To purchase packages of used shoes.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette O. is a 40-year-old, married woman from the town of Maamot, San Jose, Tarlac. Bernadette has 1 adult-age child. To earn a living, Bernadette owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. More specifically, she runs a general store, so her primary source of income is derived from selling a variety of products to her fellow community members. Bernadette has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Bernadette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she hopes to be able to better engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living. Bernadette is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Bernadette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches, which cover the Central and Northeastern areas of the country. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional products and inventory

loans.name: Doljinjav

texts.en: Doljinjav is 42 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Three of her children, ages 19, 21, and 22, attend university. Her youngest son, Dembereldodov, is 17 years old and attends a local secondary school. Doljinjav operates a mobile food and consumer product trading business with her husband. They started their business in 2001 with a working capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~  145 USD). After nine years of hard work, they have built their working capital to 1,000,000 tugrugs (~  725 USD).  Doljinjav has expanded her business and built a loyal customer base. She and her husband have been planning to rent a counter from which to sell their products to earn extra income. Doljinjav is a very hardworking person who has a good communication skills. She says, “I would like to expand my business with my family and to increase the number of our livestock.” She is requesting a 1,300,000 tugrug ( ~  940 USD) loan to purchase a variety of food products and clothing to resell them in the countryside for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is 51-year old woman, residing in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 
Munawar belongs to a poor family. Her parents couldn’t provide her with a good education, but they given her the talent of making embroidery on clothes. She started preparing embroidery, after her marriage, to spend her free time in an activity. But later on she has chosen it as a profession. Now she is making a good benefit from it. She is a very hard working lady. She prepares embroidered dresses on order and generates income. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
She is a mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her first two sons run a tailoring shop. The other two work in a local factory on a monthly wage. Her daughter is 15 years old and helps her in her decorative embroidery business. 
Her husband's name is B. H.. He runs a fruit selling business in the market. Their earnings allow them to meet the financial expenses of their family. 
Munawar has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for the third time to purchase the seasonal fruits in bulk to expand her husband’s fruit selling business.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to sell.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie T. is 57 years old and determined to make sure that her family has enough food and other items to meet its daily needs. She is married to Roel T., a government employee, and they have four children. For many years now, she has made a living running her own variety store.

Genie has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year.  She regularly attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from our cooperative. She has done a good job of using the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is applying for a new loan of PHP 22,000. She will use this money to expand her business by buying more groceries to sell to her customers. She dreams of helping her family live well and have a settled life of its own.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups which meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is made up of 15 to 30 community partners and gather weekly to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell from her variety store.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. lives in the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She makes a living by running a general store where she sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, candies, cotton, coffee and more.  She has been in this business for more than five years, and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Angelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC, and has applied for a new one to invest in expanding her small store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria D. C. is a 34-year-old, married woman from the city of Balutu, Concepcion, Tarlac. She and her husband have 3 school-age children. Gloria is the group leader of a 5-member loan group administered via ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one of them is delinquent or defaults on their loan.

To earn a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. Specifically, she operates a specialized retail store, where she sells goods to her fellow community members. Gloria has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she was able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her standard of living.
