texts.en: Enhtaivan is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter, Purevdulam, is 7 years old and attends a local primary school. His 1-year-old daughter, Serjmyadag, attends a local kindergarten and has not reached school age yet. Currently Enhtaivan operates a souvenirs and religious articles trading business with his wife near the tourist spot “Frog Rock” in his province. The province he operates the business in is one of the largest tourist attractions in Mongolia. They started their business in 2006, and have been successfully operating it since then. Enhtaivan has been planning to expand and stabilize his business in the future. He has been working hard with his wife to provide a better life for their family. Enhtaivan is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of souvenirs and religious articles in Ereen, a Chinese border town to resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling flat cakes

loans.name: Ndock

texts.fr: Ndock D. est une femme de 65 ans, elle est veuve sans enfant. Elle est depuis 5 ans membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU et y a reçu 10 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 moutons qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ndock D. is a 65-year old woman, a widow without children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Keur Ngalgou for five years and has obtained ten successive loans. She is selling livestock; her new loan will allow her to purchase ten sheep for fattening before reselling at the local biweekly fairs. Her goal is to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her livestock business

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Erdenechimeg is 51 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son, Myagmarsuren, is 20 years old and has been working in Korea for two years since he graduated from the university in Mongolia. In addition, he has 16-year-old daughter and 13-year-old son. 

During the day, Erdenechimeg manufactures iron products to sell to his many customers. He worked as a solderer in a collective farm between 1975 and 1990. Since 1990, he has been operating his own iron products and soldering business, and has steadily expanded his business. Erdenechimeg has extensive skills in manufacturing iron products and has became popular among local residents. With his earnings, he was able to pay his oldest son's university tuition fee. He and his family are honest people. His family and business are both important for him. Erdenechimeg says, “The most important thing to me is to be financially able to pay my children's education fees until they graduate and to support them in the future.” He is requesting a loan to purchase more iron to manufacture stoves and chimneys for gers.

loans.use: To purchase more iron

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparing polenta balls made of cornmeal (for sale)

loans.name: Huuhee

texts.en: Huuhee is 63 years old and lives with her two daughters in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Huuhee operates a meat and milk trading business between Mongolian and Tuva Republic of the Russian federation. Huuhee knows the Tuvan language, which is a great advantage for her business. She has been operating her business since 2000 and has built a loyal customer base. Huuhee sells meat, milk and coal from her home. With her earnings, she has been providing money for her family expenses. Huuhee has been planning to expand her business and the number of goods she is able to offer. She is a sociable and hard working person. Huuhee says, “I am working hard to provide better life for my family. ” She is requesting a loan to purchase large amounts of meat and milk at wholesales price for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Fary

texts.fr: Fary D. est une femme de 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants tous majeurs. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 3 ans et demi et y a reçu 7 crédit qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle développe une activité d'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 14 moutons qu'elle engraissera et revendra au bout de 5 mois au niveau des marches hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
Fary D. is a 68-year old woman, married and the mother of eight grown children. She has been a member of the Keur Ngalgou Banc Villegeois for three and a half years and previously obtained seven loans, all of which she managed well and always repaid on time. She raises sheep, and her new loan would allow her to purchase 14 sheep for fattening and reselling about five month later at one of the local weekly fairs. Her goal is to help contribute to her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strenghtening her livestock business

loans.name: Ivah

texts.en: Ivah is 34 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and father in Bayan-Ulgii province,Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Manat, is a nurse in a local hospital. They have 2-year-old daughter named Aimerei. Ivah operates a taxi service in his town. He purchased a car in 2007 with a XacBank loan. Since that time, he has been successfully operating his taxi service. His daily net profit is between 5,000 – 10,000 tugrugs (~ 3 – 8 USD). Ivah repairs his car monthly and always provides good service to his customers. Previously, Ivah operated a meat trading business between 2005 and 2007. Since he has started his business, his family's quality of life has been improving. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand and renovate my car.” Ivah is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~  500 USD) loan to purchase four dampers and four tires for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Nakyanakumbi F Namutebi Aisha Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is a hardworking business lady of twenty-nine years old, married with two children in schooling. She has a cloth business of which she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase cloth for sale. She is an encouraging business lady whose future hope is to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr: Madame Madina Thiam, née en 1982, est mariée mère de 3 enfants âgés respectivement de 8 ans, 4 ans et 1 an. Elle est coiffeuse de métier et depuis quelques temps, environ 3 ans,  elle s’est lancée dans la vente de produits cosmétiques, chaussures et tissus qui intéressent les femmes. En fait elle s’approvisionne très souvent au niveau des grossistes de la ville et les place à sa clientèle qui règle journalièrement ou mensuellement. Ainsi, pour renforcer cette activité elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Ms. Madina Thiam, born in 1982, is a married mother of three children, who are 8, 4, and 1 years old.  She has been a hair stylist by trade for a while now, about three years.  Madina has started selling cosmetics, shoes, and fabrics, which interest women.  In fact, she very often gets her supplies from wholesalers in town and sells them to her customers, who settle the bill daily or monthly.  And so, to bolster this business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of cloth, shoes, and cosmetics necessary for her business

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Winner B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We trust. She is 36 years old, single and has three children. She could not continue her education through 6th grade.For 3 years Winner has been selling palm oil at the Pipelines Community main road in Paynesville, Liberia.
She gave her customers good service which makes them keeps returning. Winner started selling with little funds borrowed from relatives and is now doing well, but she faces a shelter problem during the rainy season. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more palm oil for resale. Her goal is to expand her business and educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Winner is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Making and selling beans

loans.name: Kabidolda

texts.en: Kabidolda is 62 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Sameriy, is 58 years old and retired. His 27-year-old son, Asilbek, is an accountant in a local library. Currently, Kabidolda operates a transportation business with a microbus that he owns. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Kabidolda has been operating his business since 2008 and operated a variety of businesses between 2000 and 2008. He received three loans so far from Xacbank. In his first loan, he did not pay his loan on time because his two children were students at that time and he had  to pay his two children's university fees. But he is a very open and enthusiastic person. Kabidolda says, “It would be great if I could sell my current car and purchase new car for my business.” He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~  785 USD) loan to purchase a new engine to change his broken down engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase an engine

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa K. âgé de 58 ans sollicite pour la deuxième fois un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des moutons et chèvres. Il est éleveur  depuis 35 ans et fait également le commerce de bétail.  Il est Peulh une ethnie qui s’adonne le plus à ce métier d’éleveurs au Sénégal.  Il a été initié à ce métier par ses parents et y parvient à régler tous ses besoins.
Monsieur Moussa K. est marié père de 5 enfants dont la moyenne d’âge est égale à 12 ans. En plus de sa famille, il a en charges 7 personnes qui sont soient des neveux, nièces et sœurs. 
« Ce métier m’a permis entre autre de régler les besoins de la maison et j’ai même acheté une maison avec les bénéfices gagnés » dixit Monsieur K..
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa K., aged 58, is requesting for the second time a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying sheep and goats.  He has been a livestock farmer for 35 years and also trades in livestock.  He is Fulani, an ethnic group that is devoted the most to the livestock trades in Senegal.  He was introduced to this trade by his parents, and he has met all his needs through it.  Mr. K. is married and the father of five children, whose average age is twelve.  In addition to his family, he supports seven people, who would be nephews, nieces, or sisters.  "This trade has enabled me, among other things, to take care of the needs at home, and I even bought a house with the profits earned," says Mr. K..

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Preparation and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Bassirou D.  âgé de 68 ans est père de 10 enfants dont les âges varient entre 39 et 7 ans.  Il nous a accordé cet entretien lors  du montage de son dossier de crédit à  IMCEC Diourbel.
-Quel est votre domaine d’activité ?
Monsieur D. : je suis Tailleur et je confectionne des habits que je vende
-	Dites moi Monsieur D., comment vous avez choisi votre métier ?
Monsieur D. : c’est un métier que j’ai appris il y’a longtemps et  en commençant petit à petit j’ai réussi à agrandir mon métier pour gagner plus
-	Quel est l’aspect le plus important de votre travail ?
Monsieur D. : la confection d’habits,  s’il n’y’a pas production je ne parviens pas à régler mes besoins personnels et ceux de ma famille 
-	Dites-moi, l’objet de ce crédit que vous sollicitez ?
Monsieur D. : je veux acheter des tissus, fils….. etc  pour coudre des habits afin de  les revendre à bon prix
-	Quel est l’impact de ce crédit sur votre situation sociale ?
Monsieur D. : régler des besoins familiaux tout en espérant sur une bonne marche des affaires
-	Quel montant demandez-vous ?
Monsieur D. : 150 000 FCFA et je te rappelle que j’avais pris 2 crédits que j’ai réglé sans problèmes.
texts.en:
Mr. Bassirou D., 68 years old, is the father of 10 children whose ages range between 39 and 7 years old. He granted us this interview as we were putting together his loan application at IMCEC Diourbel. - What is your field of activity? Mr. D.: I am a tailor and I make clothing that I sell. - Tell me Mr. D., how did you choose your profession? Mr. D.: It is a profession I learned a long time ago and I started, and bit-by-bit I succeeded in expanding my business to earn more. - What is the most important part of your work? Mr. D.: The making of clothing, if there is no production I cannot provide for my personal needs and those of my family. - Tell me what use you will make of this loan? Mr. D.: I would like to buy fabric, sewing thread etc… to sew clothing in order to sell them at a good price. - What is the impact of this loan on your social status? Mr. D.: To provide for the family’s needs while hoping that business will be good. - What is the amount you are asking? Mr. D.: 150,000 Francs CFA and I am reminding you that I took two loans that I repaid without problem.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make new pieces of clothing and sell them.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells plastic containers at Akotokyire.  Aba has no formal educational background.  She is married to a mason by profession.  Aba has been selling plastic containers for some time now. She helps her husband pay for their accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic containers to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for sale.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie K. is a trader who sells sticks and firewood (used for cooking). He own a boat which he used to purchase the wood and sticks from an island. Sorie is married with children, two of whom are in school while the youngest is just a baby.

He has 10 dependents who reside with and they usually help him in the business. He has been in this business for over 10 years.

He was a client under the solidarity group structure with good repayment history. He is therefore seeking for a loan which he will use to buy more sticks. He hopes to use proceeds from the business to build a house and cater to his children and dependents.

loans.use: To buy firewood and sticks

loans.name: Cheikh Mouham Bachir

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Mouham Bachir Savaré né en 1979 gère sa propre activité depuis 2000. Il a commencé par la vente de téléphones portables et accessoires. 
Ainsi depuis quelques années il s’est viré dans l’aviculture un secteur qu’il maîtrise actuellement très bien. Il compte 2 poulaillers et son principal marché se trouve à Dakar où il reçoit d’énormes commandes de poulets. Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter des poussins et des aliments pour mieux renforcer l’activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh Mouham Bachir Savaré was born in 1979. He has been managing his own business since 2000. He started with the sale of mobile phones and accessories. A few years ago he transferred to poultry farming, a field that he currently masters very well. He has two chicken coops and his main market is in Dakar where he receives large orders of chickens. With this loan, he is planning on buying chicks and chicken feed to better strengthen his activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Paya

texts.fr: Paya D. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu à bénéficier 7 fois de suite de crédit. Elle développe une activité de vente de vêtements au niveau de son quartier, ce prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son niveau d'investissement afin de renforcer son commerce et de gagner plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans le prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Paya D. is a 30-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” of Keur Ngalgou for the last three and a half years and has received seven consecutive loans. She is developing a clothing sales business in her neighborhood. This loan will allow her to increase her level of investment in order to strengthen her business and to earn more profit. She will be able to help her husband in providing for the family ‘s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 33-year-old married man and father of 2 young children. He is an experienced car painter with almost 15 years of experience. After getting the needed skill, he opened a car painting shop in his hometown. He is the only provider for the family with his business income. 

Today, Richard is planning to enlarge his business operation; and he needs to borrow $1,000 to purchase a new painting compressor and so he will be able to take additionA. number of cars. And he hopes that with the help of the loan, his business will grow in the next year.

loans.use: purchase a new painting compressor

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana F. bakes sweet rock cakes to sell at Akotokyire.  Joana has not received any form of education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake the items she sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and selling of manioc flour.

loans.name: Tackou Liguèy Group

texts.fr:
Tackou Liguèy  est groupement mis en place, il y’a tout juste 2 mois 20 jours par deux dynamiques  femmes que sont Madame Khémesse N. et  Madame Kadji D.. D’ailleurs, elles sont les deux membres du groupe et est dirigé par Madame N. alors l’autre assure pour le moment les tâches de  trésorière.
Quant à Madame N., la présidente, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 20 ans, 15 ans, 12 ans et 7 ans. Elle vend des légumes et du poisson  depuis  presque 10 ans. Habitant à Diourbel au quartier Champ de course qui est loin du marché, Madame N. choisît  de mettre sur place une table pour vendre des légumes et c’est comme ça qu’elle a commencé ce métier. 
Elles sollicitent un prêt de 200 000 FCFA qu’elles vont se partager à part égale. Elles comptent toutes les deux renforcer avec ce crédit leur commerce étant donné que Madame Kadji D. gère aussi une table de légumes.
texts.en:
Tackou Liguèy is an association set up just 2 months and 20 days ago by two energetic women, who are Ms. Khémesse N. and Madame Kadji D..  By the way, they are the only two members of the group, which is lead by Ms. N., so the other handles the tasks of the treasurer for now.  Ms. N., the president, is married and the mother of four children, aged 20, 15, 12, and 7.  She has been selling vegetables and fish for ten years.  Living in Diourbel, in the district of Champ de Course, which is distant from the market, she chose to set up a table locally to sell vegetables. And this is how she started in this trade.  The women are requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA that they are going to share equally.  They both intend to use this loan to bolster their businesses, since that Ms. Kadji D. also runs a table for vegetables.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en:
Taghrid is a young woman of 19 years old. Two years ago she got married, and she has one child. She works in producing handicrafts, embroidery/needlework and all artisanal work, and she's a very talented woman. She works upon request of the clients who asks for special orders. She became well-known in her area. She works hard to support her husband. 

Today, Taghrid is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy textiles and tailoring supplies needed to increase her business productivity.

loans.use: buy textiles and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Saphie

texts.fr: Madame Saphie G. est veuve et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est âgée de 48 ans et s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans.  Elle vend des légumes au marché et s’active également dans la vente de glace et de crêmes  glacées. Elle compte améliorer son train de vie avec la marche de son commerce. Cependant, elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000FCFA pour constituer un fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Ms. Saphie G. is a widow and the mother of eight children. She is 48 years old and has been acive in commerce for over ten years. She sells vegetables at the market and is also actively selling ice and ice creams. She plans on improving her living conditions in the course of her business. However, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA in order to build up capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building up capital

loans.name: Adji Mbène

texts.fr: Adji Mbène F. est âgée de 34 ans; elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 3 ans et demi et a eu 7 bonnes expériences avec le crédit et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 14 moutons à emboucher, au bout de 5 mois elle les revendra au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Adji Mbène F. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for 3½ years and has had seven good experiences with loans.  Her new loan will enable her to buy fourteen sheep to fatten.  After five months, she will resell them at the weekly markets of her town.  Her goal is to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing and advancing her business selling livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sales of food items and basic needs items

loans.name: Rwenkuba, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
T. Irene is a determined, cheerful, 50-year-old widowed mother with seven buoyant and enthusiastic school-going children.

For the last twelve years, Irene has operated a grocery shop, selling produce like peas, beans and millet from Rwenkuba trading center. With earnings from this business she has managed to educate her children. Her likable nature has allured her to her clientele over these years and it is the reason why her business has lasted this long.

Irene is looking forward to giving her business a greater boost after getting this loan. With this loan she wants to buy more produce to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of cereals for her business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady F. est une femme mariée et âgé de 30 ans. Elle est mère de deux enfants âgés respectivement de 10 ans et 6 ans. Elle est également la mère adoptive d’une de ses nièces.  Elle est dans le commerce de divers produits depuis 5 ans. Madame Khady F. vend des tissus, parfums,lait de toilettes, pantalons, bracelets, coliers, bijoux  etc. Cependant, elle sollicitait un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour s’approvisionner en habits prêt à porter et tissus venant de l’extérieur. Selon Madame Khady F., les bénéfices tirés de son activité ne servent qu’à régler des besoins surtout la participation à la nourriture et à la santé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady F. is a 30-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children, 10 and 6 years old. She is also the adoptive mother of one of her nieces. She has been in the business of selling various products for five years. Mrs. Khady F. sells fabric, perfumes, cleansing milks, pants, bracelets, necklaces, jewelry etc…However, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Francs CFA to purchase ready-made clothing and fabric from outside of the area. According to Mrs. Khady F., the profits form her activity are only used to cover some needs, mostly to participate to the food and healthcare expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ready-made clothing and fabric for sale.

loans.name: Mingué

texts.fr: Mingué S. est une femme de 68 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 7 ans et demi et a eu 15 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle pratique deux activités; la vente de beignets en faisant du porte à porte et l'embouche ovine avec les petits ruminants. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mingué S. is a 68 year-old woman, she is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” for seven and half years. She has had 15 good borrowing experiences. She has two activities: the door-to-door sales of doughnuts and the fattening of small ruminating animals [sheep, goats]. Her goal is to help her husband in covering the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her ability to autofinance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell smoked and fried fish

loans.name: Lubowa B Lutaya Safina Group

texts.en: L. Safina is a hardworking businesswoman of forty-two years old, married and blessed with seven children. She is dealing in the poultry business, which she has been running for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase poultry feeds, drugs for the animals, and chicks, both broilers and layers. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to work hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feeds, drugs for the animals, and chicks, both broilers and layers.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima M. est cordonnier expérimenté et très connu dans sa ville. C’est un métier qu’il a hérité de son père et y a fait 20 ans. il fabrique des chaussures, n’importe quel modèle et les écoule à travers la ville et parfois même en dehors de Diourbel. Selon lui, l’aspect le plus important de son travail est donner le plaisir au client en lui fabriquant de belles chaussures. En charge de sa famille, Monsieur M., âgé de 54,  compte sur ce business pour satisfaire les besoins de sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima M. is an experienced cobbler, renowned in his town. He inherited this trade from his father some 20 years ago. He makes shoes of any model and distributes them throughout the town, and even outside Diourbel. The most important aspect of his work is to please the customer by making him fine shoes. Mr. M. is 54 years old. He takes care of his family and depends on his business to meet household needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials necessary to make the shoes on display

loans.name: La Cuadrita De Mi Barrio Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando con mucho esfuerzo, las integrantes se encuentran con muchos deseos de seguir progresando a través de los emprendimientos que todas realizan.
El comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, y cada ciclo representa un paso más hacia el mejoramiento de sus actividades.
La dedicación que cada integrante demuestra es notable, así como la señora Carmen A. con 42 años de edad , tiene 3 hijos, es una persona admirable por la forma como trabaja para ayudar a su marido  y su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles en puesto de venta que posee en su domicilio (copetín), en su negocio ademas ofrece bebidas y otros productos para sus clientes. 
Ella se levanta muy temprano para comenzar a elaborar sus productos, en esta actividad lo ayuda su hija y marido. Gracias a la ganas que le ponemos siempre salimos adelante sin ninguna dificultad y nuestros hijos se encuentran estudiando y esperamos sean todos profesionales nos comenta doña Carmen.
Desea adquirir algunas accesorios y herramientas de trabajo para mejorar la atención a sus clientes, para este fin ha solicitado el prétamos.
texts.en:
The current committee is working very hard. The members have a lot of interest in continuing to get ahead through the different types of businesses that they have. The committee is in its third loan cycle, and each cycle represents another step towards the improvement of their businesses. The dedication that each member shows is notable, such as Mrs. Carmen A.. She is 42, and has 3 children. Carmen is an admirable person- shown by the way she works to help her husband and her family. She sells food in an area that she has in her house (an eating area) and also offers drinks and other items to her customers. She gets up very early to begin preparing the food with the help of her daughter. Thanks to the energy that we put into the work, we always do well with no problems, and our children are studying and we hope that they all become professionals, comments Carmen. She wants to add some accessories and tools for her business so that she can better serve her customers. That's why she's asking for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs, plates, glasses and tablecloths

loans.name: Francisca Rosalinda

texts.es:
La señora Francisca de 52  años de edad es comerciante, cuenta con una pequeña despensa, ella es casada, su cónyuge es mecánico de una empresa de transporte, tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad que le ayudan en el negocio. 
La mayoría de los productos  que vende son de consumo masivo de la canasta familiar. Empezó gracias a la ayuda de su cónyuge, actualmente cuenta con una despensa bien surtida y clientela formada.
 
Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de una nueva congeladora, ya también quiere ofrecer a sus clientes productos lácteos y estos necesariamente deben estar refrigerados, ella esta con mucha esperanza de conseguir el crédito y así fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Francisca is 52 years old. She is a storekeeper, and her store has a small pantry. She is married. Her husband is a mechanic at a transportation business. They have three children, all of whom are grown and help with the business. The majority of the products sold in the store are for daily family consumption. She began her business with the help of her husband. She currently maintains a well-stocked pantry and an established customer base. She is asking for a loan from the Paraguaya Foundation to buy a new refrigerator since she now offers her customers dairy products, which need to be refrigerated. She is full of hope to get a loan in order to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Bolo

texts.fr: Madame Bolo M.  s’active dans le commerce depuis 1989. Elle vend près de l’hôpital régional de Thiès. Elle y étale des fruits (banane, pommes, oranges, melon….).  Elle sollicite cependant un crédit de 75 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bolo M. has been involved in commercial activities since 1989. She offers fruit for sale (bananas, apples, oranges, melons, …) next to the regional hospital in Thiès. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 FCFA to strengthen her activity.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell cornmeal mush and fritters

loans.name: Mirian Clara

texts.es:
La Señora Miran Clara M. Ocampo de 32 años de edad trabaja como comerciante,(vendedora de remedios medicinales), variedades de productos los vende por varias zonas(Villarrica, san Juan Nepomuceno, Caazapa y otros).
 El mismo trabaja con su cónyuge el señor,. Ovidio Duarte también comerciante el mismo va y comercializa los remedios, de casa en casa; ya sobre pedidos.
Ella primero recorre los negocios de varias la zona  como Independencia, Caazapa, Villarrica etc., para las solicitudes de pedidos y luego llevan los productos directamente a los negocios.
Con miras a mejorar el estilo de trabajo y de esa forma poder obtener mayor ganancia solicita el préstamos a la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de una moto ya que de esa forma podrán movilizarse bien para los pedidos y entrega de productos(remedios naturales medicinales).
Agradece por la ayuda recibida ya que su deseo es de seguir trabajando y prosperar con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirian Clara M. Ocampo is 32 years old. She sells a variety of medicinal products in Villarrica, San Juan Nepomuceno, Caazapa, and other districts. Her husband, Mr. Ovidio Duarte, also helps with the business. He markets the products and takes orders door to door. She goes to businesses in Independencia, Caazapa, Villarrica, as well as other districts. She takes the orders and delivers them in person. With the goal of improving the way she conducts business and earning a higher profit, she has asked Fundación Paraguaya for a loan to buy a motorcycle. With the motorcycle, she and her husband will be able to take orders for the medicinal products and deliver them more efficiently. She is grateful for the help. Her goal is to continue working and get ahead for the benefit of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Nar N. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 12 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 moutons qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 5 mois. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nar N. is 44 years old, married and the mother of nine children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for six years and has acquired a solid experience in credit loans, after being granted 12 successive loans. She fattens sheep and her new loan will enable her to buy ten sheep to fatten and resell after five months. Her objective is to participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ten sheep for fattening

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. operates a provisions shop at Akotokyire. Sarah has no educational background.  She is married to a mason. Sarah has been selling provisions for some time now. She helps her husband take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Mirian De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Mirian de 28 años de edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años.
Emprendio esta actividad gracias a la ayuda económica de sus padres, actualmente cuenta con  un puesto de ventas en el mercado de la ciudad donde ofrede sus productos.
Las frutas frescas son los productos mas vendidos así como: naranjas, manzanas, peras, pomelo y las variedades de verduras como tomate, cebolla, papas y otros.
Mirian se encuentra trabajando con muchos deseos de superación y agrandar su negocio comprando otros productos y mayor cantidad. Esta actividad comenta que ayuda a su familia con los gastos de la casa ya que ella mantiene la casa de los padres por que vive con ellos.
Pero se encuentra muy conforme con su trabajo y por lo mismo solicita el  préstamo a la  Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra de más frutas y verduras en cantidad.
Agradece a  las organizaciones que hacen posible el prestamo, ya facilitan el trabajo de muchos trabajadores que desean progresar y muchas veces no cuentan con los medios suficientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirian is 28 years old. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for a living for several years. She started the business with financial help from her parents. At the moment, she sells her products at her own stall in the city market. Fresh fruits are her best selling product. She sells a variety of fruits and vegetables: oranges, apples, pairs, pomelos, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, etc. Mirian has a strong desire to improve and to expand her business by buying additional products in greater quantity. She lives with her parents and the business allows her to cover home expenses and to support her parents. She is very happy with her work and has asked for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy additional varieties of fruits and vegetables and to buy greater quantities of her products She is grateful to the organizations that secure the loans. They make it possible for many people to get ahead who may not have the financial means to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo D. González de 48 años de edad es comerciante conocido en la zona, se dedica a la venta de varias mercaderías (productos de limpieza, productos de consumo, productos frigoríficos).
Empezó hace mas de 5 años trabajando por cuenta propia y con la ayuda de su señora lograron adaptarse al trabajo.
Su negocio muy concurrido y nos comenta que el negocio con un poco esfuerzo deja buena ganancia y mantiene muy bien todos los gastos de la familia.
Solicita dicho préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra articulos de limpieza, escobas, repasadores, golosinas, embutidos, y otras mercaderías que se encuentran en oferta(mercaderías que por promoción se encuentran con los precios muy bajos).
texts.en:
Mr. Osvaldo D. González is 48 years old; he is well-known as a businessman in the district. He sells cleaning supplies, food staples and refrigerated foods, as well as other types of merchandise. He started the business more than five years ago and with the help of his wife it has gone well. The business attracts a lot of people and he states that with dedication he has been able to obtain good profits and cover his family’s expenses more than adequately. He has asked for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy cleaning supplies, brooms, dishcloths, candy, sausages and other types of merchandise that he buys when he finds it on special offer.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brooms (straw and metal), dishcloths, detergents and other cleaning supplies, as well as candy, sausages and other products.

loans.name: Ndiamé

texts.fr: Ndiamé N. est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et demi et a reçu 11 fois de suite de crédit et en a fait toujours une bonne gestion et remboursé à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 10 moutons et les engraisser pendant 5 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés locaux. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndiamé N. is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for 5 ½ years and has been granted 11 successive loans which she always managed well and reimbursed on time. She fattens sheep and will buy 10 sheep to fatten for five months, and resell them in local markets. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. sells provisions such as toffee, biscuits and other groceries at Akotokyire.  Esi has received a junior high education. She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a painter. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 46 years old and married with 5 children aged between 25 years to 13 years old. Two of the children are attending school. She is a farmer in Kapomboi location in Kitale town. She has been in the business for over 25 years and sells her milk to the local milk vendors. She also earns some income from her posho mill.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. Annah is happy that from the dairy farming her family's health will improve and she will be able to educate her 2 children still in school. She is also requesting Juhudi to diversify its loan products to range from dairy farming to maize farming.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and married with five children aged 5 to 13 years. All of them are attending school. He is a farmer in Chemororochi Town in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been in this business for 12 years selling his milk in the local market. Ali is also a carpenter offering his carpentry services in the local market. He has been in this business since 1998. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs 46,800 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future he intends to diversify his personal farm and acquire four other dairy cows.

Ali is grateful to Juhudi because his family is now enjoying milk through the dairy cow he acquired with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida A. is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school.  Vida sells yams, gari (cassava grits) and beans at Akotokyire. She goes round her locality selling the yams but the gari and beans are sold in front of the house. Her husband is a mason.  

Vida uses her income to help her husband take care of the family.  Vida will use the loan to purchase more yams, gari and the raw beans for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more yams, gari and the raw beans for sale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amelia  tiene 60 años, es separada hace 5 años, tiene un comedor frente a una Fabrica donde les da de desayunar, almorzar y de cenar en alguno casos a los chóferes de camiones de cargas y sus ayudantes que vienen a retirar los productos, ella  tiene varios hijos pero ya todos están  casados y  tienen su familia.
La Sra. Amelia  actualmente esta  alquilando el local donde vive y tiene su comedor pero su idea mas adelante es comprar esa casa ya que le resulta el negocio por la ubicación.
 El proyecto de este crédito es la compra, Utensilios  y Equipos para la mejor atención y sus clientes ,como mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia, 60, has been separated for 5 years. She has a restaurant across from a factory where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to the drivers of trucks and their helpers who deliver products there. She has several children but they're all grown and have their own families. Sra. Amelia is now renting the space where she both lives and operates her restaurant, but she would like to buy it eventually. The purpose of this loan is to buy utensils and other supplies, such as tables and chairs, for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es músico.  Trabaja con su orquesta en acontecimientos sociales, su esposa es comerciante y distribuye productos a crédito; esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia, tiene 1 hija.

Vive en alquiler, su domicilio esta ubicado en la Zona 12 de Octubre  de la ciudad de el Alto. 

El préstamo lo destinará a la renovación de equipos para su Orquesta.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro. El análisis socio-económico indica que Manuel está en condiciones de solicitar un préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a musician. He plays with a band at social events. His wife is a merchant and sells her products on credit. Their income is the main source of income for the family which includes their daughter. Manuel lives in a rented house in the Zona 12 de Octubre neighborhood of the city of El Alto. Manuel will use the loan to repair the band's equipment. This is Manuel's first IMPRO loan. A socio-economic analysis indicates that he meets the conditions for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment for entertainment business.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua M. is 66 years old and married with 6 children aged between 35 and 22 years old. Two of the children are attending college. Joshua is a farmer and has been in this business for over 30 years. He sells his products to the local market and he depends mainly on farming to meet his family's basic needs. 

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project. He will increase the number of poultry he owns and expand his supply of eggs to other areas. Joshua is grateful to Juhudi because this loan will increase his income and thus enable him meet his family's needs.

loans.use: Poultry Farming

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura trabaja como comerciante en la venta de verduras, su esposo es transportista y pertenece al sindicato transportes Achocalla, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su familia, tiene 3 hijos con la edades de 12, 7 y 5 años. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Achocalla. 

El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de material para la construcción de su casa (cemento, arena, estuco, fierro).
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Buenaventura operates a business selling vegetables. Her husband is a driver and belongs to the Achocalla tranportation union. Their income supports the family which includes 3 children, 12, 7 and 5 years old. Their house is the Achocalla neighborhood. The loan will be used to buy material for building a house (cement, sand, stucco, iron bar). This is Buenaventura's third IMPRO loan. Her past payment record makes her a good candidate for soliciting new loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 40 years old and married with two children aged 14 years and 10 years. Both of them are attending school. Duncan is a dedicated farmer from Kipsomba Location in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been in the farming business for 10 years, selling his milk and maize at the Kenya Cooperative Cremeries and National Cereals and Produce Board respectively. He also earns some income from his large-scale poultry project after resigning from a security firm. 

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kshs 36,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future he intends to open up an Agrovet in which he will be selling poultry and dairy feeds in his own building. He is grateful for having joined a vibrant group that enables members to stimulate each other economically.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 53 years old and married with four children, ranging in age from 15 to 22 years old, with the two youngest still in school. He has run a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for over 30 years now, and sells maize, beans, tea and milk for his main source of income. He says that the main challenges to his business are the spread of disease among livestock and the high price fluctuation for his goods.

George is a new Juhudi Kilimo client and has requested his first loan for Kes. 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will increase the family's wealth and allow him to meet all of the family's other expenses. In the future, he would like to move into zero grazing for his cattle and hopefully produce more milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a small-scale farmer in western Kenya, near Kitale town. She is 49 years old and married with six children, all of whom have finished their education. Ruth has been farming for 29 years now, selling her milk and staple goods to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and local market respectively. She also runs a kiosk and posho mill in the same building. The two businesses have enabled her to earn a living and meet her family's expenses. 

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Ksh 25,000 to improve her poultry project. The extra income from this loan will allow her and her husband to be independent and not forced to rely on family members for financial assistance. In the future, Ruth hopes to move to a more strategic farming location and be prosperous. She also wants to construct rental homes on a plot of land she acquired years ago.

loans.use: To expand poultry project.

loans.name: Yuvenalis

texts.en:
Mr. B. is 56 years old and married with five children aged 15-30 years, of which two are still attending school. He is a farmer in Bondeni Location in the outskirts of Kitale Town. Yuvenalis has been in the farming business for 10 years and sells his maize and beans in the local market. He depends solely on farming since he had to close down a kiosk he was operating due to bad business. 

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KSh 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to venture into zero grazing by increasing the number of dairy cows he owns. He believes that this will increase his income and enable him to live a more comfortable life.

Mr. B. is grateful to Juhudi and hopes that the smallholder farmers will be empowered through products offered by Juhudi.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
El señor Néstor Y. vive en anticretico, en la zona de Pasankeri, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Alicia Acarapi y sus dos hijos.
El señor Néstor trabaja como albañil en construcciones particulares de esta ciudad y su esposa es empleada domestica, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito será para la conclusión de un baño ya que su vivienda no cuenta con ese importante servicio para su familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Nestor Y. lives in the Pasankeri neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of La Paz with his wife, Alicia Acarapi, and their two children. Sr. Nestor is an independent construction worker in the city and his wife works as a cleaner for a family. Their incomes support their family. The loan will be used to finish a bathroom for the family because their house lacks that important feature. This is Nestor's first loan. A socio-economic analysis shows that he is a good candidate for the loan and that it should be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add bathroom to house.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony W. is 35 years old and married with four children aged 6 months to 11 years old. Three of the children are currently attending school. He is a hard working farmer from Bondeni Location in Kitale Town. He has been in this business for 7 years selling his maize, beans and cabbages to local vendors. He also earns some income from the transport services he offers using his motorbike. 

He has requested his second loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He intends to expand his business by increasing the number of cows he owns and tilling more land for his farming activities. In the future, he hopes to make enough income from the sale of milk to enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El señor Américo Q. vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Llojeta, ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Américo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad de La Paz, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito será para la conclusión de obra fina de una habitación que le cedieron sus padres en su vivienda.
Esta es la segunda vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Americo Q. lives in his parent's house in the Llojeta neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. Sr. Americo works as a public bus driver in the city of La Paz and he makes enough to pay basic expenses. He will use the loan to finish a room in his parent's house. This is Sr. Americo's second loan and a socio-economic analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan and should be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room in parent's house.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Ramírez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo.
La señora Isabel es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto ambulante de su zona, y su esposo trabaja  como chofer de transporte publico.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la construcción de dos habitaciones en su vivienda.
Esta es la novena vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel Ramírez lives in her own house in the region of Pasankeri, to the west side of the city of La Paz with her husband, Francisco Quispe

Isabel is a cook and sells lunches on foot in her area. Her husband works as a chauffeur on public transportation. She would use this loan to finish construction on two rooms of their home.

This is the ninth time that she has asked for a loan and socioeconomic analysis shows they are well qualified and have access to loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing construction on their house

loans.name: Mcharuko Group

texts.en:
Zainabu Hatia, age 46, is married with four children, aged 27, 18, 16 and 11. She has had a clothing sales business since 2006. She works from 9 am to 9 pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $349.

This will be Zainabu’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more clothes to sell and she has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the clothing stock and to open another clothing shop. 

Zainabu will share this loan with her subgroup loan group, Charuko Group, which totals 6 members. These members deal in selling food, clothes and have shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Zainabu is first on the left.

loans.use: To increase clothing stock and start another clothing shop.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngonéy D. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE dont elle fait partie du comité de gestion, et y a reçu 15 crédits qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est vendeuse de céréales, d'arachide et de sucre. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngonéy D. is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past 7 ½ years, is part of its management committee, and has been granted 15 credit loans, all well managed and reimbursed on time. She sells grain cereals, peanuts and sugar. Her objective is to assist her husband in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Better develop and promote her commercial activity

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
El señor Marco A. Calderón vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Tembladerani, ubicado en la ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Marco trabaja como empleado de una empresa de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que se mantiene.
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una computadora, imprescindible para sus estudios ya que esta cursando los últimos cursos para graduarse de contador.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco A C. lives in his parent's house in the Tembladerani neighborhood on the western side of the city of La Paz. Sr. Marco works for a company in the city and his income pays his basic expenses. He will use the loan to buy a computer, something he has to have for school. He is taking the last classes he needs to get a degree in accounting. This is the first time that he has applied for a loan. A socio-economic analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan and should be granted one.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer that is needed to complete accounting degree.

loans.name: Briston One Group

texts.en:
Cecilia K., aged 20, is single. She has had a food business for 3 years. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $148.

This will be Cecilia’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase stock and the quality of her food business. 

Cecilia will share this loan with her subgroup, Briston group, which totals 6 members. These members deal in selling clothes, timber, food and tailoring. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Cecilia is the one squatting in red.

loans.use: To improve her food quality and quantity.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es Chofer asalariado de trufi 88 Sindicato Eduardo Abaroa. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su familia: su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 años y 8 meses de edad. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de motor  para el trufi con el que trabaja y que es su herramienta de Trabajo. 
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para el préstamo solicitado por Freddy.
texts.en:
Freddy is a salaried "trufi" driver--a trufi is a van or other vehicle that carries passengers along a set route--and a member of the Eduardo Abaroa union. His income supports his family which includes his wife and two young children who are 2 years and 8 months old, respectively. He lives in a rented house in the Cotahuma neighborhood of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy an engine for the trufi, something that Freddy needs to work. This is his first Impro loan. An analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy engine for taxi business.

loans.name: Kugumikiriza Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
With ten grownup school-going children and one dependent to cater for, 47-year-old cheerful bread-winner, Z. Simon, has no choice but to work excessively hard selling his fruits and vegetables in Jinja central market. This has been his main source of livelihood for the last twenty-two years.

With the little income from his business, Simon has managed to provide for his wife, kids and relatives. In good weather months, he says he makes profits totaling 100,000 shillings or even more. His main source of lamentation over the years has been the bad weather spells which, in effect, mean he has to make do with fewer supplies from farmers.

What has made Simon’s business grow is the fact that he has struck a chord with most of his clients and suppliers on the basis of his good business line of conduct. His future plans are to be able to easily transport his fruits and vegetables to his clients far away from his operating place.

With this loan, Simon says he is going to boost his business by paying for more deliveries of fruit and vegetable supplies from his farming business partners.

loans.use: To pay for more deliveries of fresh fruit and vegetable supplies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 51 year old married man with 3 children. He has owned a mini-market in his town since 1999. His mini-market is situated in a busy area, so he has been able, over the years, to have a growing number of clients pass by his grocery store. He offers all types of food products, soft drinks and juices, cereals, detergents, etc. and he is the only one who can take care of his family with his business income. 

Today, Ahmad is requesting to borrow $1,000 to increase his store’s inventory because, along with the majority of store owners, he has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demands.

loans.use: To increase his store’s inventory.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel V. de 45 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su esposa se llama Rosa( en la foto aparecen juntos) ellos tienen 1 hijo que estudia en una escuela del Gobierno. 

Miguel aprendió desde pequeño administrar tiendas gracias a sus padres que tenían una pequeña tienda. Pero por la frustrante idea de Miguel seguir los mismos pasos de sus padres y querer tener su propio negocio decidió después de casarse comprar unos cuantos víveres con sus ahorros y venderlos en un local que construyo en su casa.

Miguel ahora trabaja en conjunto con su esposa desde las 06:00 am hasta el anochecer vendiendo arroz, azúcar, bebidas, aceite etc. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la competencia de otras tiendas al rededor de la suya  ya que el lugar donde esta la tienda es muy comercial.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, aceite para su tienda. En el futuro quiere adecuar mejor su local e incrementar la línea de productos en su tienda para poder asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel V., 45, lives in a suburb of Guayaquil called Paraiso. He and his wife Rosa (who is also in the photo) have 1 son who is in a public school. Miguel learned how to manage a store at a young age thanks to his parents who owned their own small store. He wanted to follow in his parent's footsteps and have his own store, something he was able to do after he married. He bought some basic products with his savings and sold them from a space that he set aside at home. Miguel now works, together with his wife, from 6:00 in the morning to late at night selling rice, sugar, cold drinks, cooking oil, etc. One of the obstacles he faces is competition for other stores in the area because the neighborhood is heavily commercial. Miguel will use the loan to buy drinks and cooking oil for the store. In the future, he wants to improve the shop and increase the lines of products in the store to help him ensure the future of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Tulwanirewamu Group, Kampala

texts.en:
W. Joy is a 38-year-old female farmer based in Naluvule, Kampala. She has five children, all going to school.

Being a small-scale farmer has not helped Joy dispense with hard financial circumstances since she began five years ago. Being a farmer, she has worked hard to grapple with a myriad of problems such as the constant chicken diseases that have drastically affected her poultry.

With a little help from friends Joy has managed to overcome most of her problems. In a month, she says she makes close to 80,000 shillings from selling her chickens. Her future plan is to transform her poultry farm into a large scale farm entity that will support her and her family in the near future.

With this loan, Joy also wants to give her poultry venture a renewed lease of life.

loans.use: To purchase new chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more oil, peanuts, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Ilva

texts.es:
Ilva tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en la casa que le dejaron sus suegros. DesD. hace 10 años se dedica a la venta D. dulces D. manera ambulante, siendo sus 2 triciclos sus herramientas que le ayudan a transportar su mercadería para vender. Su rutina diaria es estar en la búsqueda D. algún espacio D. la calle para instalarse y vender. Uno D. los lugares más estratégicos es el exterior D. la puerta del colegio, dándole ventaja en la venta y aún más cuando hay temporadas D. eventos dentro del colegio, por haber más concurrencia D. gente. Los productos que venD. son refrescos, gaseosas, galletas y caramelos, por tal motivo desea abastecerse D. mercadería, ya que asegura que sus ventas son exitosas. Para el futuro espera comprarse un triciclo para abarcar la mayor cantidad D. productos para la venta. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, además fue invitada a formar parte D. su grupo comunal, ya que saben que es una persona emprendedora. Manifiesta que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio.
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en golosinas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Ilva is 41 years old, lives with her husband and six children in the house left to them by their in-laws. For the last 10 years she has been peddling sweets, using her two carts as tools to help her transport her merchandise. Her daily routine is to find a space in the street to install her cart and sell her goods. One of the most strategic locations is outsiD. of the gate of the high school, which gives her an advantage, especially when there are events at the high school because then there are more people.

She sells sodas, drinks, cookies, and candy and wants to stock up on merchandise to insure her sales are successful. In the future she hopes to buy another cart so that she can incluD. a greater quantity of products.

This is her first loan with MFP; she was also invited to form part of group since they already know she is a entrepreneurial person. She believes the loan she receives will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan she will buy more merchandise like snacks and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sodas and snacks to stock her store

loans.name: Kyaterekera Development Group Of Mpigi

texts.en:
N. Lazia is not one to play second fiddle in whatever she does. In that regard, she has owed it to herself to lay great store upon her only source of income – a 7-year-old restaurant business in Bukendula, Mpigi district. She has been unwavering in her determination to succeed, ever since she lost her husband three years ago.

Where Lazia is in her business now is such an incredible testament to her endurance and hard work. She is now envisaging opening future new horizons for herself by expanding into the hotel (a larger restaurant) business. She foresees a bright future for herself and her seven children if this comes to pass

In a week, Lazia says she makes more than 50,000 shillings, enough to cater for her family’s welfare. With this loan, she is upbeat with conviction that she will purchase and store enough foodstuffs for her restaurant. She is also optimistic that in the near course of time she will expand into the more lucrative hotel business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: produce and sell palm oil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. C. has been enjoying the income generated from her painting business. This business means she has been able to support her family's needs and improve their lives. As a consequence, Monica is encouraged to work harder and aim higher for her business and family with the help of loans she can access to support her business. Therefore, she wants to take this opportunity to grow her business by requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP from Kiva partner, ASHI, which she will use as additional business capital.
Monica wants to buy a larger volume of materials for her painting business, and hopes to attract more clients as well as securing the loyalty of her regular customers. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Monica is determined to achieve business success and build more long-term financial security for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy a larger volume of materials for her painting business

loans.name: Rwenyangi Group

texts.en:
A friendly and hardworking N. Beatrice, aged 45 years, is happily married with a family of five children aged between 25 and 10 years.

Beatrice’s business story began way back in 2000. She started up a restaurant preparing local dishes and this has contributed a lot towards the welfare of her family. By being strategically located and handling her customers with good customer care, she has been able to  keep her customers.

This loan is to help Beatrice in modernizing her business with new furnishings that are eye-catching to bring customers into her business. With that she will be able to realize more sales and profits that will trigger her development economically, and enable her to meet the day-to-day expenses and general welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy furnishings for her restaurant

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición se forma hace aproximadamente 1 año, integradas por señoras con ganas de trabajar y con muchos deseos de progresar.
Todas ellas se unieron y decidieron trabajar para ayudar a sus familias ya que cada uno pertenece  a familias de escasos recursos y hasta ahora a todas  le va muy bien.
La mayoría de las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos de uso doméstico en el asentamiento en el cual residen así como en el centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo como en otros barR. de la misma ciudad. 
 La señora Ceferina tiene una actividad muy peculiar la cual es la venta de asaditos a costado de la calle del mercado de la ciudad. 
Ella con su marido preparan los asaditos(pedacitos de carne condimentada, cocinadas por un palito de madera), y muy temprano en horas de la mañana viajan hasta su puesto de venta y cocinan su preparado para vender, además ofrecen gaseosas para vender.
Ella solicita el crédito para algunos gastos y para la compra de carnes variados, vacuno, porcinos, de aves y otros.
texts.en:
The Bendición (Blessing) committee was organized approximately a year ago by a group of women who very much want to work and make progress. They decided to band together to help their families since all of them are members of low-income families; to date, they are doing well. Most of the women in the committee sell home products in the settlement where they live as well as in downtown San Lorenzo and in other neighborhoods in the city. Ceferina, for example, has a very unique business: she sells ‘asaditos’ alongside the municipal market. She and her husband prepare the asaditos (skewers of seasoned grilled meat). Very early in the morning they go to their sales stand to cook and sell their products; they also offer soft-drinks for sale. She is asking for funds to buy assorted meats: beef, pork, fowl etc. as well as to pay some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: smoke and sell fish

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina vive en la  zona de Puerto Mejillones  de la ciudad de El Alto con sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar,  su esposo es chofer de transporte publico.
 
Corina comercializa chuño, tunta y queso, alimentos que vende al por menor en los mercados de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará  como aumento de capital de trabajo para comprar sus productos en mayor cantidad para abastecer la demanda que tiene. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Corina lives in the Puerto Mejillones area of the city of el Alto with her school aged children; her husband is a public transportation driver. Corina sells chuño (freeze-dried potato), tunta (Andean potato) and cheese at retail to various markets in the city. She will use the funds to increase her working capital to buy products in larger amounts to satisfy customer demand. This is her 2nd loan with Impro and the socio-economic evaluation undertaken indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of freeze-dried potato, Andean potato and cheese.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en una casa heredada por sus padres. Desde hace un año, se ha dedicado en la venta de edredones y cubrecamas en ferias comerciales, este comercio lo hace de manera ambulante. En algunas ocasiones su esposo y sus hijos la ayudan en esta labor, otras veces su ventas lo realiza, ofreciendo a sus amistades y vecinos, dejando a crédito la mercadería. Este negocio le ha permitido a Jenny percibir ganancias, que le ayudaron a establecer su economía y mantener estable su negocio. Sus planes será incrementar su capital y vender otros artículos más para el hogar. Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, además fue invitada a formar parte de su grupo comunal, porque la conocen como una persona responsable y trabajadora. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más edredones y cubrecamas al por mayor, para tener mayor variedad de productos y ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jenny, 37, lives with her husband and 4 children in a house she inherited from her parents. For the last year she has sold comforters and bedspreads in markets; she does not have a fixed sales point. Sometimes her husband and children help her with her work and on other occasions she sells to her friends and neighbors, leaving the merchandise on credit. The business has produced profits for Jenny that have helped her maintain her family’s and her business’s economic stability. Her plans are to increase her capital to sell more home products. This is her first loan with MFP; she was invited to join her communal group because she is known to be a responsible and hard-working person. She will use the requested funds to buy more comforters and bedspreads at wholesale in order to have more varied stock to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more comforters and bedspreads.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 30 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y calzado. Ella tiene más de 11 años de realizar esta actividad, ella da inicio a este negocio porque tenía que ayudar a su Mama ya que además Claudia tenía que pagar sus estudios ya que esto obligo a que estudiara sabatino, así podría vender los productos y  ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, por lo que agradece a su Mama que desde muy joven le enseño el trabajo humilde. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, trajes de baños para la temporada de verano. Su deseo es tener su propio establecimiento.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria is 30 years old. Her business is the sale of clothing and shoes. She has been doing this for more than 11 years. She began this business because she needed to help her mother, and furthermore, she had to pay for her schooling, and this obliged her to study on Saturdays, so that she would be able to sell her products and help with the household expenses. She is thankful to her mother, who, from the time when she was young, taught her humble work.

She is asking for this loan to buy pants, shirts, and swimming suits for the summer season. Her wish is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María M. de 48 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicio básicos. Es soltera con hijos ya mayores de edad y casados.

Comenzó con un fogón de madera en las afueras de su casa vendiendo almuerzos por la necesidad de mantener estudiando a sus hijos ya que ella era el único sustento en su hogar. Poco a poco con los ingresos que tenia fue ahorrando y comprando mesas y sillas para adecuar mejor su lugar de trabajo.

En la actualidad ella tiene su propio restaurante de comidas rápidas en la que trabaja sola desde las 06:00 am cocinando platos como arroz con pollo, pescado apanado, churrasco y arreglando el local. La preocupación que tiene es que trabaja sola y por el sector donde vive hay mucha delincuencia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, aceite y arroz para preparar más comidas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su restaurante.
texts.en:
María M. is 48 years old. She lives in a suburban area in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is single with children who are already grown and married.

She began with a wood fire outside of her home, selling lunches because she needed to keep her children studying and because she was the only one supporting her home. With her profits, little by little, she was saving and buying tables and chairs so that she could better adapt her workplace.

Now, she has her own restaurant serving quick meals where she works alone from 6:00am, cleaning and cooking meals such as rice with chicken, fried fish, and pork. Her worry is that she works alone in an area where there is high delinquency.

With this loan, she wants to buy sugar, oil and rice to prepare more meals. In the future, she would like to improve her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil and rice

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: EL SEÑOR RUBEN ES CASADO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA YA HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO EL INICIO SU VENTA CON UN CAPITAL MINIMO E INGRESOS RELATIVOS YA CON EL TIEMPO Y CON MUCHO SACRIFICIO LOGRO COMPRAR EL KIOSKO EN EL QUE ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU VENTA Y TIENE INGRESOS PARA PODER MANTENER A LOS HIJOS QUE TIENE LOS CUALES ESTUDIAN EN EL ESCUELA Y EN SU TIEMPO LIBRE AYUDAN EN LA ATENCION DE LOS CLIENTES Y SU ESPOSA LE AYUDA EN LA ELABORACION DE LOS PLATOS QUE OFRECEN.
