EL SEÑOR TIENE MUCHAS METAS PROYECTADAS UNA DE ELLAS ES LA DE COMPRAR UN KIOSKO MAS AMPLIO PARA SATISFACER  A MAS CLIENTES CON SUS DELICIOSOS PLATOS DIARIOS, CON EL DINEROP DEL C REDITO COMPRARA UN REFRIGERADOR Y ASI MANTENER SUS PRODUCTOS FRESCOS, ES UN APERSONA JOVEN RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA CON MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION Y ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Ruben is married, and his business is selling food. Quite a long time ago, he began his business with minimal capital and a small income. Over time, with much sacrifice, he was able to buy the kiosk where he currently sells his products. He now has sufficient income to support his children, who are in school. His children also help serve customers in their free time, and his wife helps prepare the dishes they offer. Ruben has many goals for the future; one of them is to buy a larger kiosk so that he can satisfy more customers with his delicious daily meals. With the funds from the loan, he will buy a refrigerator, so that he can keep his products fresh. He is a responsible and hard-working young man with a great desire to improve his life, and he is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food produce & mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Marly Sofia

texts.es:
Marly Sofía R. Martínez, tiene 41 años vive en el barrio Soledad 2000;  está casada, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, y se dedica al negocio de las confecciones de pijamas, multiusos, edredones y bolsos desde hace 12 años; con él fin de tener mayor diversidad en su oferta y ampliar su mercado solicita un crédito por valor de $1.500.000, con el que comprará materiales para la confección, como correderas, telas y forros. 
A Marly le ha ido muy bien pues cuando hace 12 años inició su actividad de confecciones, lo hizo  produciendo solo bolsos, y gradualmente aprendió a elaborar multiusos edredones y pijamas, teniendo que comprar   una  fletadora para este tipo de confección  y luego fue agregando otras tres máquinas.  Ella desde que comenzó con la Fundación, ha visto mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y así mismo en la microempresa aumentó la producción, reflejada en una mayor infraestructura en sus equipos. Su sueño es continuar ampliando su negocio, para que sea lo suficientemente grande para comercializar sus  productos en otras plazas de la Costa Caribe. Entre sus desafíos está el de sostenerse siempre vigente y con salud para conseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Marly Sofía R. Martínez is 41 years old. She lives in the Soledad 2000 neighborhood. She’s married, has a 6-year old child, and has worked in a business sewing pajamas, multi-purpose comforters and bags for 12 years. With the goal of having more diversity in her offerings and growing her market, she is requesting a loan of $1,500,000.00, with which she will buy materials for sewing, such as carriages, thread and lining.

Marly has been doing very well. When she began her business 12 years ago, she was producing only bags. Gradually, she learned to make multi-purpose comforters and pajamas. She has to buy a special tool for this type of sewing, and later she added three more machines. Since she has begun with the Fundación, she has improved her living conditions and augmented the production in her small business, reflecting a better infrastructure in her teams. Her dream is to continue growing her business, so that it will be big enough to sell her products in other plazas along the Caribbean Coast. Amongst her challenges is to always be effective and healthy to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for sewing, such as carriages, thread and lining.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca Nelly  G. tiene 43 años y vive  en Bogotá en una   localidad llamada Suba, que con numerosas  zonas verdes y llanuras hace de este sector un hermoso paisaje natural para familias residentes  y trabajadores  de industrias, comercio y servicios que la circundan.
Blanca Nelly tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que depende de ella, por eso trabaja intensamente como comerciante de cosméticos mediante catálogos  e independientemente vende perfumería ropa y electrodomésticos,  una actividad que aprendió cuando estudió tecnología en mercadeo  y ventas y  en la que desde hace 12 años se desempeña, después de haber dejado de trabajar en una entidad financiera. Con el propósito de aumentar su dinamismo en el mercado,  solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 con él comprará ropa y cosméticos, para sostener un inventario moderno, porque su clientela la conforman empleados de empresas donde antes trabajaba y compañeros de trabajo de sus familiares asì como amas de casa que les gusta estar a la moda. Blanca está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 4 años mediante los cuales ha recibido  3 créditos, ella aprecia el servicio de financiamiento y formación empresarial  de esta organización, porque mediante ello ha logrado tener solvencia económica para adquirir mercancías y no perder clientes que requieren respuestas exactas y  oportunas.
Sueña con aumentar sus venta para poder abrir su local y estabilizarse económicamente y asì ofrecerle a su hijo una educación de calidad hasta que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Blanca Nelly G., 43, lives in an area of Bogotá called Suba which, thanks to its abundant green areas and level ground makes it a beautiful natural setting for residents and employees of industries, commerce and services that surround it. Because Blanca Nelly has an 8-year-old son that depends on her, she works intensely as a catalogue cosmetics saleswoman; she also sells clothing, home appliances and perfumes independently. She learned this skill when she studied marketing and sales and she’s been in this line of work for 12 years after leaving work in a financial institution. In order to increase her market presence, she is asking for a $2.000.000 loan to buy clothing and cosmetics so that she will have an up-to-date stock inventory. Her customers are, for the most part, employees of companies where she used to work, co-workers of her relatives and housewives who like to be fashionable. Blanca has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the last 4 years; she has received three loans in this period of time. She appreciates the financing and business training she gets from the institution because, though them, she has acquired economic solvency to buy merchandise and not lose customers who require exact and opportune responses. Her dream is to increase her sales in order to open her own shop and become economically stable so that she can offer her son a quality education leading to a professional degree.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. sells fresh groundnuts and 'Fante kenkey' at Akotokyire.  Ama has received senior high education.  She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a teacher. 

Ama orders the 'Fante kenkey' to sell. At the time of our visit she was yet to receive her 'kenkey' (maize dough) consignment.  She helps her husband in providing food, clothing and shelter for the family. Her loan will be used to buy maize to start preparing 'Fante kenkey' herself and also to buy fresh groundnuts for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: to buy maize to start preparing 'kenkey' herself

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA INES  ES SOLTERA, ES UNA SEÑORA MUY TRABAJADORA, VIVE CON SUS HERMANOS YA QUE ELLA NO CUENTA CON UN DOMICILIO PROPIO, TIENE UNA MAQUINA TEJEDORA MANUAL EN LA QUE CONFECCIONA CHOMPAS DE LANA Y LAS COMERCIALIZA EN UNO DE LOS MERCADOS MAS CONOCIDOS DE EL ALTO Y  DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA ACTUALMENTE CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO TIENE EN MENTE COMPRAR UNA MAQUINA MAS GRANDE Y CONTRATAR A ALGUIEN QUE LE AYUDE CON LA CONFECCION Y ASÍ PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO, ELLA ES UNA PERSONA QUE TIENE MUCHAS METAS Y SOBRE TODO MUCHAS GANAS DE TRABAJAR, TIENE EL APOYO DE SUS HERMANOS QUIENES LA QUIEREN MUCHO YA QUE ELLA CUIDO DE ELLOS DESDE PEQUEÑA Y LA QUIEREN COMO UN MADRE Y LA RESPETAN Y LE APOYAN EN TODAS LAS DESICIONES QUE ELLA TOMA.

LA SRA. INES ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Ines is a single, very hardworking woman. She lives with her brothers because she doesn’t have her own home. She has a hand operated knitting machine with which she makes wool sweaters that she sells in some of the better known markets of El Alto and the city of La Paz. Her current thought is that with the money from the loan she will buy a bigger machine and hire someone to help her make sweaters. In this way she will be able to make her business grow. Sra. Ines is a person who has a lot of goals. Above all she wants her business to succeed. She has the support of her brothers who love her a lot since she cared for them since they were little. They love and respect her like a mother and support all her decisions. Sra. Ines is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a knitting machine.

loans.name: Aida Esther

texts.es:
Todo el que va al centro comercial Metrocentro, al sur D. Barranquilla, se acerca al negocio D. Aida Esther P. D. F., que  a sus 68 años sigue siendo una mujer agradable, amable y con un gran carisma para relacionarse apropiadamente; ella tiene una pequeña chaza a la entrada D. este centro comercial, donD. venD. deliciosos pasabocas, refrescos y dulcería en general, que compra D. contado a distribuidores en su barrio; esta es la  razón por la cual está solicitando su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor D. $800.000 para invertirlo en la compra D. gaseosas, confites  y pasabocas, con él continuará aumentando su capital D. trabajo y siempre estará surtida y lista para vender sus productos.  
DesD. el año 1996 empezó su actividad, pasando D.  vender lotería por las calles D. Barranquilla, cuando esa actividad era muy rentable, a su negocio actual que reemplazó al primero  porque decayó este mercado cuando la loterìa se tecnificò. Aida tiene una gran capacidad D. trabajo, su actividad se extienD. desD. la 10:00 A.M. hasta la 11:00 P.M. y durante todos los días D. la semana; sus clientes son los peatones que circulan por el lugar, los propietarios D. otros negocios en los locales, vendedores estacionarios D. mercancías variadas y cachivaches. Ella llegó a la FMSD hace tres años y con sus financiamientos ha obtenido logros como incrementar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y con los créditos tener un capital D. trabajo para surtir permanentemente, lo cual es muy importante porque no ha necesitado hacer más préstamos gota a gota.
Su gran sueño es mejorar su vivienda y ahora tiene el desafío D. ajustar su horario D. trabajo para tomarse un tiempo diario en descansar un poco, y disfrutar D. su populoso y alegre barrio La Ciudadela 20 D. Julio, lleno D. actividades comerciales, centros recreativos como el Estadio Metropolitano donD. Juega el equipo D. Futbol  que apasiona a muchos costeños “El Junior D. Barranquilla” .
texts.en:
Everyone who frequents the Metrocentro shopping center in the south of Barranquilla visits Aida Esther P. D. F. who, at 68 years of age, continues to be a pleasant, kind woman with great charisma for interpersonal relationships. She has a small sales case at the entrance to this shopping center where she sells delicious snacks, beverages and assorted sweets that she buys from distributors in her neighborhood for cash. This is why she’s asking Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her second loan, valued at $800.000 to buy soft-drinks, sweets and snacks so that she will always be well-stocked and ready to sell her products. She started out in 1996 selling lottery tickets in Barranquilla’s streets when that was a very profitable business. Her present business replaced the original one because lottery sales declined and the industry became more technological. Aida has much capacity for work; her work day extends from 10am until 11pm every day of the week. Her customers are pedestrians that amble by, owners of other local businesses, stationary sellers of assorted merchandise and knickknacks. She began her collaboration with FMSD three years ago; her loans have helped her increase her business by being able to permanently have stock available. This has been very important because she hasn’t had to take out other nickel and dime loans. Her great dream is to improve her dwelling and she now has the added challenge of trying to adjust her work schedule in order to take a bit of daily rest to enjoy her crowded and cheerful La Ciudadela 20 D. Julio neighborhood which is full of commercial activities and recreational centers, like Metropolitan Stadium, where the football team, “El Junior D. Barranquilla,” which is the passion of many coastal residents, plays.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, sweets and snacks.

loans.name: Dania Azucena

texts.es:
la sra. Dania Azucena H. R. tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de una hija de 12 años, producto de su primer matrimonio del cual esta separada, en la actualidad vive en union libre con el señor Jorge Lopez quien 
labora para la empresa nacional de energia electrica y tambien se dedica a la agricultura.
Dania se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en el barrio el portillo de la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, con esta actividad cubre algunos gastos de su hogar; el credito lo utilizara para ampliar su inventario de ropa.
Su anelo es graduar de la universidad a su unica hija para que pueda salir adelante en el futuro.
texts.en:
Dania Azucena Hernández R., 30, is separated from her first husband and has a 12-year-old daughter; she currently lives with Jorge Lopez who is employed by the national electric company and is also a farmer. Dania sells new clothes in the Portillo neighborhood of the city of San Marcos de Colon. This activity makes it possible for her to pay some of her household expenses; she will use the requested funds to increase her stock inventory of clothes. Her wish is that her only daughter graduate from university so that she can be successful in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed linens, women's and men's underwear, t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba E. sells fruits such as bananas, guavas, avocados and other fruits at Akotokyire.  Araba has no educational background.  She is a widow living with her six dependents. She is going to add the loan she will receive to her initial capital to buy extra bananas and other locally grown fruits to sell. She is responsible for the general welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy varieties of fruits for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop to sell in.

loans.use: buy varieties of fruits for sale

loans.name: Gladys Augusta

texts.es:
L. socia Gladys; pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”, situado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años D. edad elL. es soltera, no tiene hijos y nuestra socia es secretaria D. profesión, elL. también tiene su propio taller D. corte y confección, L. socia diseña hermosos trajes D. vestir y trabaja en el centro D. desarrollo humano desD. hace 1 año; Nuestra socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio, elL. desea comprar telas, hilos, y utilizar parte D. ello para el capital D. su negocio.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio para elL. poder seguir generando divisas y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. L. deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gladys, 51, is a member of the “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. She is single and has no children. She is a secretary by profession but also has her own dressmaking workshop. She designs beautiful dresses and has worked in the human development center for a year. She needs funding to invest in her business; she needs to buy fabric and thread and will use part of the funds to capitalize her business. She appreciates and values the loan granted by this means so that she can continue to generate income and pledges to repay her entire loan in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread and to increase her business's capital.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace siete años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, el brinda su servicio dentro de la ciudad de Chepén y su labor empieza desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy avanzada la noche, como esta actividad es el unico ingreso con el que cuenta para sostener a su familia, el trata de mantenerse en el negocio esforzandose al máximo.

El tiempo que ha venido utilizando a la mototaxi y el excesivo uso han comenzado a generar fallas mecánicas en el vehículo, impidiendo su correcto funcionamiento, José desea reparar estas fallas y brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi para que esta pueda funcionar correctamente, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es un padre luchador y que trabaja dia a dia incansablemente para ver progresar a su familia, su mayor anhelo es crecer como empresario para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, los cuales lo consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
José, 46, is married and has two children; he lives with his family in Chepén district, Chepén province, La Libertad region which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For the last 7 years he has provided passenger and cargo transportation services in a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) in the city of Chepén. His work day begins very early in the morning and extends until well after nightfall. Because this is his only source of family income, he tries he exerts the maximum effort to stay in business. Excessive use over a long period of time of his mototaxi has begun to cause it to need repairs. José needs to service it so that it will continue to provide good service; for this reason he is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa to request his first, 800 new sol, loan to reach this goal. José is a tenacious father who works tirelessly to see his family progress; his greatest wish is to grow as a businessman and provide them a better quality of life. He is quite well-known and esteemed by his neighbors who consider him to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Polleritas Group

texts.es:
Natividad M. de 48 años casada con Gregorio C. tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio que queda ubicado en la zona Paraíso calle Omasuyo. Ella necesita el préstamo para fortalecer su tienda comprando mercadería.
 Las demás integrantes se dedican a diversas actividades económicas como el tejido de mantas, venta de plásticos, costura de ropa polar, tejido de chompas y venta de comida.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Panamericana.
texts.en:
Natividad M., age 48, is married to Gregorio C.. She has a neighborhood shop in her home located on Omasuyo Street in the Paraíso area of La Paz. She needs the loan in order to build up her shop’s inventory.

The rest of the members of the group are engaged in various businesses such as weaving blankets, selling plastic goods, sewing winter clothing, weaving sweaters, and selling food. They all need the loan in order to acquire merchandise and raw materials. They meet every two weeks in the Centro Focal Panamericana.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory and raw materials.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is married and has four children. She has not received any form of education.  Amina sells fruits and vegetables near a market at Akotokyire. Her husband is a driver.  Amina uses the income she generates from the sale of her fruits to help her husband in the general upkeep of the home.  Amina will use the loan to purchase more fruits and foods like plantains for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Amina plans to save to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: purchase more fruits and foods for resale

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
la sra. Amanda E. P. es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta produccion y venta de tortillas, en las tardes despues de todas las ventas de tortillas se dedica a vender golosinas en el barrio de Monjaras. Amanda esta casada con el señor Santos Douglas Varela quien se dedica a la construccion y con quien han procreado 7 hijos de los cuales 5 aun dependen de ellos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y otros alimentos para hacer las golosinas, Amanda espera que todo le salga bien para seguir trabajando y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amanda E. P. is a hard-working person who manufactures tortillas for sale. In the afternoon, when the tortilla sales are over, she sells snacks in Monjaras neighborhood. She’s married to Santos Douglas Varela who is a construction worker; they have 7 children, 5 of which still depend on them. She will use the requested funds to buy supplies and ingredients needed to make tortillas and other items to make snacks. Amanda hopes that things will end favorably so that she can continue working and providing a better quality of life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, lime powder, water, beans, lard, spices, pork, chicken and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 38 años de edad ella tiene mucha experiencia con los financiamientos pues han sido su principal fuente de ayuda.  Su actividad es la venta de ropa. Es madre de 2 hijos y que estaña a su cargo. Ella tiene 10 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos por lo que recorre lugares muy lejanos para ofrecer lo que le encargan. Siempre esta depositando sus cuotas en tiempo y forma por lo que siempre busca la forma de mantener los ingresos para su hogar. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es seguir trabajando como lo ha hecho pues solo así lograra mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria, 38, has two children under her care. She has a lot of experience working with loans because they have been her main source of help. She is a clothing merchant; she has been in this line of work for 10 years. She travels far and wide to fill orders. She always deposits her installment payments in a timely fashion and is always looking for ways to maintain her household income. She is asking for funding to buy raw materials because she has several pending orders to fill. Her wish is to continue working as she has done to date because this is the only way she will manage to make some needed home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Help Your Self Group

texts.en:
Oretha W., 45, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty. She is involved with the sale of charcoal and has been doing this business for the last 21 years. Her business is located in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia. She started this business through the help of a family member. She is married with seven children whose ages range from 12-23 years old and are currently in school. She also helps to take care for two siblings.

The challenge she faces is that there are so many vendors selling charcoal in the market. Oretha plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more charcoal to improve the business. Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe tiene 54 años, está casado con Amelia de la misma edad, juntos viven con sus 3 hijos y un nieto de 7 años, en su casa propia. Él es un hombre que siente que alcanzó sus objetivos en la vida, pero lo que más le pone contento es saber que sus hijos son felices. Desde hace 25 años se ha dedicado a la agricultura, en donde tiene 20 hectáreas de terreno y solo 8 le falta aún cultivar. Paralelamente a su actividad, tiene dos tiendas de venta de comestibles y un taller de cerrajería, donde arregla cerraduras de puertas y ventanas de metal. En oportunidades trabaja solo en la chacra, pero en épocas de remover, limpiar el terreno y cosechar, es donde contrata operarios para que le ayuden en este arduo trabajo, en tanto su  esposa atiende una de las bodegas y con ello, le ayuda a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Más adelante, planea terminar de plantar productos naturales de esta zona, en sus tierras que falta sembrar, ya que espera obtener ingresos económicos y pueda dar beneficios a sus hijos y nietos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y como dirigente de su grupo siempre procura que sean mas unidos y compresivos entre si, es por ello que es muy querido y respetado, por lo que se siente bien trabajando con ellos. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará cientos de sacos de guano de corral para nivelar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Felipe, 54, is married to Amelia, also 54. They live together in their own home with their three children and a 7-year-old grandson. He is a man who feels that he has reached his goals in life; what makes him most happy, however, is knowing that his children are happy. He has been a farmer for the last 25 years. He has a 20-hectare lot, 12 of which are planted. He also has two grocery stores and a locksmith shop where he repairs door locks and makes metal window grilles. Sometimes he works his fields alone. But when it’s time to clear, clean and harvest the fields he hires hands to help him with these arduous chores. His wife tends to the stores thus helping him cover household expenses. For the future he plans to finish planting plants that are native to this area in his remaining fields because he hopes to earn additional income that will benefit his children and grandchildren. This is his 6th loan with MFP and, as group leader; he’s always striving for them to be unified and understanding among themselves. For this reason, he is well liked and respected and he feels good working with them. He will use the requested 2000 soles to buy hundred of sacks of guano to equalize his fields’ productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guano.

loans.name: Eyirba

texts.en: A. Eyirba sells spices and soap, she sells by going from one house to the other in and around Akotokyire.  A. has received junior high education.  She is married to a carpenter and has two children.  A. has been selling spices and soap for about a year now. She helps her husband in feeding the entire family. Her loan will be used to buy other soaps and spices for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build on a piece of land inherited from the family.

loans.use: buy other soaps and spices for sale

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
Luz L. de 49 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera tiene un niño que estudia en una escuela del gobierno.  

Hace años atrás Luz no tenia como mantener su hogar y por la necesidad tuvo que poner una cabina telefónica en su casa para sus vecinos, aunque no le rendía muchas ganancias ella poco a poco comenzó a ahorrar.

En la actualidad por la buena administración que tuvo puso más cabinas telefónicas en su casa pero ya con la publicidad de una empresa telefónica muy famosa en el Ecuador llamada “Porta”. Trabaja desde las 08:00 am hasta el anochecer, también vende tarjetas y recargas para celulares desde $ 1.00 hasta $ 30.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tarjetas y recargas telefónicas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere adecuar el local con más cabinas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Luz L., 49, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso in Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. She is a single mother of a son who goes to public school. Years ago Luz had no way to support her home so she had to set up a phone booth in her house for her neighbors to use. Although it didn’t produce much income at first, gradually she began to have some savings. Currently, thanks to the efficient way she ran it, she installed more phone booths in her house but now having publicity from a very famous phone company in Ecuador called “Porta.” She is open for business from 8am until nightfall; she also sells pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharges for from $1.00 to $30.00. She will use the funding to buy pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharges for her business. In the future, she would like to set up even more phone booths in her location.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pre-paid phone cards and cell phone recharge points.

loans.name: Silvia Antonia

texts.es: la sra. Silvia Antonia V. P. tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos que ya estan mayores y trabajan. Silvia se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia Paola, esta ubicada en el barrio Cedeño numero 2 de la comunidad de Monjaras, esta comunidad esta cerca del mar y es una de las zonas de mucho movimiento a tal grado que esta catalogada como la aldea mas adelantada de Honduras, el credito lo utilizara para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Antonia V. P., age 46, is the mother of two grown children who work. She is engaged in the sale of popular consumer products. She has a small grocery shop that operates under the name Pulperia Paola. It is located in the Cedeño Number 2 neighborhood in the community of Monjaras. This community is close to the sea and is in an area of so much development that it is considered the most advanced town in Honduras. The loan will be used in order to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, oats, cereal, milk, cheese, butter, lard, oil, salt, condiments, bottled water, juices, beans, corn meal, flour, bread, cookies, churros, candy, popcorn balls, rice, tortillas, sugar, coffee, soups, and pasta.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria Maria tiene 44 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que viven de manera independiente. La señora se dedica a la elaboración de comida, y está ubicada en el mercado, los fines de semana es que ella vende sus platillos en las afueras de su vivienda. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 14 años, cabe señalarse antes ella también vendía ropa usada, sin embargo dejo este negocio debido a que se ha aumentado mucho y ya no se gana lo mismo, de allí que ella decidió establecer la venta de comida. Este crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de granos básicos y productos variados para la compra de materia prima, esto con el objetivo de surtir la variedad de platillos ofertados por la señora. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante algún día y brindar trabajo a todos sus conocidos que se encuentran desempleados.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is 44 years old; she is single and has 2 children who live on their own. She prepares and sells food at a market close to her house, on the weekend she sells her dishes from her house . She began this business 14 years ago. In the past she also sold used clothing, but as competition has grown one can no longer earn as much; thus, she decided to dedicate herself solely to selling prepared food. She is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains and varied staple products so that she may offer a greater variety of dishes. Her dream is to one day have her own restaurant and hire all her acquaintances that are currently unemployed.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase staple goods to produce prepared dishes for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a widow and has two children. She has no educational background. Adjoa smokes (processes) fish for sale at Akotokyire. Adjoa uses the income she acquires from the sale of her smoked fish to educate her children.  Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more frozen fish to smoke (process) for sale. With the new income from her extended business, Adjoa plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more frozen fish to smoke (process) for sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
la sra. Elsa D. H. tiene 50 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de refrescos y productos de uso personal como ser cremas, desodorantes, cosmeticos, lociones, perfumes, esmaltes de uñas. 
tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.

Elsa vive en la aldea de los Mangles, esta aldea esta cerca de las fincas de caña y de empacadoras de melon.
la mayoria de sus clientes son empleados de las cañeras y algunas meloneras. Elsa tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 estan al cuidado de ella.
esta casada con el sr. Julian Escobar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos y unos productos de uso personal ya que tiene varios pedidos y no los ha comprado por falta de capital.
texts.en:
Elsa D. H. is 50 years old. She works selling soft drinks and personal care products like creams, deodorants, cosmetics, lotions, perfumes, and nail polish. She has been doing this for 5 years. She lives in the town of Los Mangles. This town is near the sugarcane farms and the melon packaging plants. Most of her customers are employees of the sugarcane farmers, and some are melon packers. Elsa has 5 children, and she still takes care of two of them. She is married to Julian Escobar. She will use this loan to buy more soft drinks and some personal care products since she now has several orders that she hasn't filled for lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and personal care products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jardines Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Florentina Q. de 47 años  tiene un taller de Chapería que conjuntamente con su esposo ha podido sacar adelante. Inicialmente su esposo trabajaba en una fábrica de micros, donde aprendió estas habilidades de reparación,  con el pasar del tiempo esta empresa cerró y él se quedo sin trabajo, es entonces cuando decide poner su propio taller y volverse independiente, ahora con el préstamo comprarán un tanque de oxígeno. 
Florentina considera que es accesible el préstamo, además le gusta compartir con sus compañeras y visitar al consultorio.
Las demás integrantes de esta asociación tienen variados negocios de producción servicio y comercio.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima. 
Ellas se reúnen cada dos semanas en el Centro Focal Villa Tejada.
texts.en:
Florentina Q., 47, has an auto repair shop which she, together with her husband, has made a success. Initially, her husband worked in a microbus factory, where he learned repair skills. Eventually the business closed, and he was out of a job. That is when he decided to open his own shop and work for himself. Now, with the loan, they will buy an oxygen tank. Florentina believes the loan is accessible, besides which she likes to share with her companions and visit the loan office. The other members of this association have businesses offering various goods and services. They all need the loan to buy merchandise, supplies or raw materials. They meet every two weeks at the Villa Tejada regional office.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital purchases, merchandise, supplies and raw materials

loans.name: Mother Blessing Group

texts.en:
Esther B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Mother Blessing. She is 37 years old, married and has four children who range from 3 to 20 years old, and she also cares for a sibling. She could not continue her education through 5th grade due to the Liberian crisis.

For 3 years, Esther has been selling cooked food at the 72nd Oldfield in Paynesville, Liberia. She cooks her food well and talks to customers in a nice manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Esther started by assisting other people to run their food centers, but she is now on her own selling cooked food. However, she now faces a problem of not having a permanent spot for business.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 40,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more food to serve customers. Her goal is to grow her business to a better size and have a good structure.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Esther is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more food to serve customers.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato tiene 53 años, es soltero y vive en su casa propia con su madre, Sabina de 81 años, a quien cuida con dedicación. Ejerce la profesión de docente de nivel primario, sin embargo el amor a las tierras que lo vieron nacer, han hecho que se dedique al cultivo de frutas cítricas, paltas y plátanos, por lo que han pasado 40 años realizando esta actividad de manera independiente. Desde entonces esta actividad lo realiza solo o con ayuda de operarios que contrata para las campañas de siembra y cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de esta actividad, es la temporada de cosecha, el ver sus productos de buena calidad y en proporción, sabe que es gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que puso sobre sus tierras, a su vez le parece difícil trasladar sus productos hacía los mercados de la ciudad o hasta los centros de acopio para comercializarlos. Para su futuro, planea comprar una casa en la ciudad, donde pueda instalar una bodega que le genere utilidades, asimismo quiere comprar más chacras cerca de su domicilio actual. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y como es una persona respetable, ante su grupo comunal, se compromete a pagar puntualmente para continuar accediendo  a más créditos futuros y no defraudar la confianza que le brindan. Con los mil soles que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, así como insecticidas, que le ayuden a controlar las plagas de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fortunato is 53 years old. He is single and lives in his own house with his mother, Sabina, 81 years old, whom he cares for with dedication. His profession is primary school teacher. Nevertheless, his love for the land where he was born has led him to raise citrus fruits, avocados, and bananas, and he has done this independently for 40 years. He has carried out this activity alone or with the help of workmen whom he hires for planting and harvesting. What he likes most is harvest time. When he sees his products of good quality and good size, he knows that it is due to the effort and dedication that he put into his land. At the same time, it is difficult for him to transport his products to the markets in the city or to the collection centers to sell them. In the future, he plans to buy a house in the city, where he can set up a shop that will generate profits for him. He would also like to buy more farms near his present home.

This is his first loan with MFP, and as he is a respectable person in his community bank, he promises to make the payments on time, so that he can continue accessing more credit in the future and not betray the confidence that they have shown in him. With the thousand PEN that he is applying for, he will buy sacks of organic fertilizer, as well as insecticides, which will help him control the pests on his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy organic fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es: La señora Alma Nidia tiene una farmacia por lo que está ubicada en un lugar donde transitan muchos clientes, hace mas de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente. Por lo que siempre se ha encargado de proporcionarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios, siempre ha sido una mujer responsable.  Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de diversidad de medicamentos, ya que esta farmacia es bien solicitada por los clientes, debido a que los precios del medicamento son más favorables que en otras, su esposo trabaja como conductor para un empresa de camiones, junto a su esposo han logrado salir adelante con el negocio y la familia. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia has a pharmacy located in an area where a lot of people pass through. She has had this business for more than 2 years, because she has always liked to work in an independent manner. Since she has always been in charge of providing her children with an education, she has always been a responsible woman. She requests a loan to buy a variety of medicines, since her pharmacy has a lot of customers, owing to the fact that her medicine prices are lower than in other businesses. Her husband works as a driver for a trucking company. Along with her husband she has managed to get ahead with her business and her family. She dreams of improving their income for their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Guembe Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento GUEMBE  es un grupo integrado por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varon, son oriundos D. distintos lugares D. Bolivia  como ser Montero, Santiestevan, Santa Cruz, Warnes, Chuquisaca, Oropeza.

La Presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento Guembe  es la Srta. Gleidy soltera es estudiante y se dedica  a la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo, estudia una carrera tecnica y tiene muchos deseos D. superacion vive sola y se mantiene sola es muy trabajadora y responsable y solidaria con sus hermanos a los que les da una cantidad D. dinero cada mes para sus gastos, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia D. promosion y despues poder vender al precio orignal.  
 
Todos los socios viven en la misma Zona km 9 barrio cambao hace bastantes años todos cuentan con negocios en la zona ramada cerca al mercado mas populoso D. Santa Cruz, 3 integrantes cuentan con  puestos propios  y algunos son ambulantes, todas las socias son Madres D. familia en la gran mayoria son concubinas y otros solteros y otras esperan nueva familia, ellas sueñan seguir creciendo con los prestamos que le otorga emprender tienen metas y sueños que ellas confian que lo van a conseguir como tener casa propia local propio vehiculo empresarios y viajar ,ver a sus familias que se encuentran lejos, todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Guembe Communal Bank is comprised of nine members. There are eight women and one man. They are originally from different places in Bolivia like Montero, Santiestevan, Santa Cruz, Warnes, Chuquisaca, and Oropeza. Gleidy is the president of the Guembe Communal Bank. She is single, and she is a student. She sells cosmetics by catalog. She is studying for a technical career. She has a lot of desire to improve herself. She lives alone and supports herself. She is very hard-working, responsible, and supportive of her siblings. She gives them some money every month for their expenses. She will use the loan to buy merchandise on promotion. Later, she will be able to sell it for the original price. All of the members live in Zona km 9 in the Cambao neighborhood. For several years they all have had businesses in the sheltered area near the most populous market in Santa Cruz. Three of the members have their own stalls, and some members are street vendors. All of the women are mothers. Most of them are in common law marriages, some are single, and some hope for a new family. They dream of continuing to grow with the loans from Emprender. They have goals and dreams that they are confident they will fulfill. Some of these are having their own house, their own stall, having a business vehicle, and traveling to see their families who are far away. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua S. prepares 'Fante kenkey' for sale at Akotokyire. Ekua is a widow who has six dependents to take care of. She attended junior high school. Ekua has been selling 'kenkey' (maize dough) and supplying it to her customers for some time now. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'Fante kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

In her hands are a few 'kenkey' balls to show how it looks. The food is well protected and preserved in a plantain leaf which turns blackish after boiling. 'Fante Kenkey' can keep for more than two days without going bad.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'Fante kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa S. est une femme de 47 ans qui habite à Ngor une localité  avoisinante du village de Ouakam. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Ouakam depuis 2 ans par le biais de sa fille coiffeuse qui est un ancien membre de la caisse de Ouakam  ayant  déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts au sein de l’institution. Elle est marie et mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active depuis 12 ans dans le commerce et la vente de légumes et de produits locaux. La raison du choix de son activité est la recherche de revenus gagnes a la sueur de son front en vue de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des besoins familiaux. L’aspect qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité  est la fidélisation  de sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs destine a l’achat de légumes et a l’augmentation de son stock de produits locaux (mil, mais, etc.…). Son objectif est de conquérir une nouvelle clientèle en augmentant son offre de produits.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa Sam is 47 years old, and lives in Ngor, a locality next to the village of Ouakam. She has been a member of the Ouakam branch of U-IMCEC for two years. She was introduced by her daughter, a hairdresser, who was a former member of the Ouakam branch and had received several loans from the organisation. She is married and the mother of eight children. For the past twelve years she has been actively involved in the trade and sale of vegetables and local products. Her reason for choosing this activity is to generate income through her own work and assist her husband in managing family needs. What interests her most in this line of work is ensuring customer loyalty. She is requesting a loan for 100,000 francs she will use to buy fruit and increase her stock of local products (millet, corn, etc…). Her objective is to gain new customers by increasing the quantity and range of her products.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Arasely Patricia

texts.es: Arasely Patricia posee un negocio de elaboración de tejas y ladrillo ubicado en las afuera de la ciudad. Desde hace tres años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ha sido otorgado de generación en generación y ha puesto de mucho empeño por seguir adelante. Es madre soltera y con su arduo esfuerzo a mantenido a su hijo, realiza sus compras de materiales para el negocio. Pero el crédito lo maneja de manera selectiva ya que algunos clientes no le pagaron ocasionándole pérdidas al negocio, pero a pesar de esto ella utilizara el financiamiento para capital de trabajo necesario. Su deseo es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Arasely Patricia has a business making roof tiles and bricks on the outskirts of the city. She's been in this business for three years; it's been passed down through the generations of her family and she's put a lot of effort into it in order to get ahead. She's a single mother who's worked hard to take care of her son and buy materials for her business. She's selective about offering her services on credit, since some clients haven't paid her and forced the business to take some losses. Nevertheless, she'd like to expand her business and will use this loan for necessary working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Americo forma parte del banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES”, tiene 36 años, es casado  y tiene dos hijos (Estefani y Traici). El brinda servicio de transporte en un taxi que el alquila. Ya son 18 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Americo es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para ahorrar el dinero y después juntar $12000 para comprar un carro de segundo uso. El anhelo del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.  El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Americo is a member of the Los Diamantes village bank. He is 36 years old and married, and has two children, Estefani and Traici. He is a taxi driver with a rented taxi. He's driven the taxi for 18 years and it's gone very well because of his commitment to his work. Americo is a hard-working person with a lot of initiative, and he's always looking for ways to improve his situation and offer his children a better future. He needs this loan so he can save up 12000 soles to buy a used car. He dreams of owning a new car. The village bank has been through 10 loan cycles, and Americo says he's very satisfied with the professional development and loan and savings services the group offers. He's very grateful for the opportunity the groups provides him and is committed to paying off this loan on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save up to buy a used car

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua C. is a petty trader who moves from house to house to sell her items around Akotokyire. She sells a small variety of goods like powdered soap, toothpaste and silver bowl cleanser and others.  Ekua has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is an electrician. She helps her husband with the general welfare of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to resell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús es una persona alegre y optimista, tiene 42 años, y está felizmente casado con Olga de 30 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos y juntos viven en su domicilio propio. Tiene 10 años desempeñando la labor de agricultor, en donde siembra cacao, achote, frutas cítricas, paltas y plátanos, y con ayuda de su hijo el trabajo le es menos pesado. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar paltas, puesto que le gusta este fruto y más aún si estas provienen de sus propias chacras. Hace algunos años quiso generar utilidades para su familia, es por ello que instaló una fabrica de escobas, elaboradas con hojas de árbol, que son muy resistente, vendiéndolas en la tienda de su madre. Ahora quiere enseñar a las personas de su comunidad a criar aves sobre todo una raza de gallina “Ginea”, caracterizado por tener un lindo plumaje; de igual manera desea criar pavos, para que así pueda tener ingresos adicionales y pueda ofrecer mejor beneficio a sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y considera que le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, por estar integrado por personas compresivas y unidas que piensan en su progreso como grupo. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará comida, especial para aves y algunos sacos de maíz.
texts.en:
Jesús is a happy, optimistic person. He's 42 years old and happily married to Olga, 30. They have five children and live together in their own home. He's been working as a farmer for 10 years, growing cacao, annatto, citrus, avocados, and plantains, and his son helps him and lightens his workload. His favorite is harvesting avocados, since he likes to eat them, especially if they come from his own farm. A few years ago he wanted to produce more profits for his family, so he set up a broom-making workshop, making the brooms out of strong dried leaves and selling them in his mother's store. Now he wants to show the members of his community how to raise Guinea hens, known for their lovely plumage, and he'd also like to raise turkeys to bring in more income and offer a better life to his children. This is fifth loan with MFP. He likes working with his communal bank, since its members are sympathetic team players who think about how to move forward as a group. He will use the 500 soles he's requesting to buy feed for his fowl, as well as a few sacks of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy feed and sacks of corn

loans.name: Jessika Mayra

texts.es:
Jessika, tiene 31 años, es soltera y es natural de Cusco. Ella es profesora egresada de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Actualmente, Su actividad principal es ser profesora del colegio “Túpac Amaru II” de la ciudad de Sicuani. Su actividad económica complementaria es la producción artesanal de Yogurt y los vende los fines de semana. Ya es un año que se dedica a la venta yogurt y le va muy bien. Jessika es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar ollas que sirve para hacer hervir la leche. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una fábrica de producción de mantequilla, queso y yogurt.       

Jessika pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jessika is 31 years old. She is single and is a native of Cusco. She has a degree in teaching from the National University San Antonio Abad of Cusco. Now her main activity is teaching at the Túpac Amaru II school in Sicuani. Her supplemental economic activity is the production of artisanal yogurt, which she sells on weekends. She began selling yogurt a year ago, and it is going very well. Jessika is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who always looks for opportunities to advance with her daily efforts.

She needs the loan to buy pots for boiling milk. Her dream is to open a factory to produce butter, cheese, and yogurt.

Jessika belongs to the community bank "Los diamantes" (the diamonds) of the Arariwa Association. The bank has been functioning for 10 loan cycles, and this member declares that she is content and satisfied with the credit services, savings, and training for the time that she has been a bank member. She is also grateful for the opportunity offered through the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pots

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina había solicitado un financiamiento anteriormente, por lo que no es la primera vez que busca esta manera de mejorar su capital. Su esposo  trabaja como chofer por lo que también aporta para el ingreso de la familia. Aduce la señora que ha logrado crecer su negocio y ha logrado obtener mayores utilidades al vender más. Algo que ha influido, es que ella administra su negocio de una buena manera. Lo que la ha afectado, es que constantemente están cambiando el precio de estos productos. Por eso solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo así comprara leche, cuajada, queso y crema.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina has applied for financing previously, so this is not the first time that she has sought this way of increasing her capital. Her husband works as a driver, so he also contributes to the income of the family. It is clear that she has succeeded in increasing her business and in obtaining better profits from selling more. One influence on her success is that she administers her business well. Something that affects her is that they are constantly changing the price of these products. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to be used for working capital to buy milk, curds, cheese, and cream.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
L. socia Elizabeth; pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO INC”, situado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años D. edad elL. es casada, no tiene hijos, Nuestra socia es Arquitecta D. profesión, elL. está elaborando un proyecto particular en L. dirección D. una obra, L. socia es muy reconocida en el campo D. L. construcción y diseño D. los inmuebles, elL. disfruta D. su trabajo al máximo y pertenece a este banco comunal junto a su hermana por L. razón D. compartir las reuniones con amigos y D. mantener este vinculo que le permite ver a sus amigos una vez al mes mientras el resto del mes está trabajando y muy ocupada, L. socia Solicita el préstamo para algunos gastos personales.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. L. deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao Inc”, which is in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 45 years old, married, and does not have children. Elizabeth is an architect by profession and is engaged in a particular project as part of her work. She is well-known in the construction field for designing buildings. Elizabeth enjoys her work to the fullest. She and her sister joined this Communal Bank so that they could attend the meetings with their friends. This allows them to maintain their friendships since they meet once a month and are either working or busy the rest of the time. Elizabeth is requesting a loan for some personal expenses.

She values and appreciates the loan that has been provided to her and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Michel

texts.es:
doña  Michel P. es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, el cual es una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion en la aldea de el Triunfo, departamento de Choluteca.
doña Michel se levanta las 5 de la mañana para atender a su clientela y luego irse a trabajar a una escuela como maestra. Mientras esta dando clases su esposo se hace cargo de la pulperia, los dos luchan por salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener bien surtida la pulperia.
texts.en:
Doña Michel P. is an enterprising woman who is dedicated who her business. She manages a grocery store from her home in the neighborhood of El Triunfo, which is in the Department of Choluteca. Doña Michel wakes up at 5am so that she can attend to her customers before leaving for her job as a school teacher. While she is teaching classes, her husband manages the store. The two of them struggle to get ahead.

The loan will be used to buy more merchandise so that her store will be well-stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina, tiene 25 años y es soltera. Su actividad económica principal es trabajar en un laboratorio clínico como técnico y su actividad complementaria es vender productos de belleza. Ella nos cuenta que su mamá Apolinaria tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatoria en el mercado “Molino I”. Ya son  5 años que se dedica a  la venta de productos de belleza y ya son dos años que su mama que se dedica a la venta de golosinas y les va muy bien. Karina es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el crédito para comprar productos de belleza e invertir en el negocio de su mamá. El anhelo de la socia es estudiar en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Biología y también desea estudiar una maestría en “Biología Molecular o Bio Tecnología”.        

Karina pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Karina is 25 years old and single. She works as a clinical laboratory technician and also sells beauty products as a side business. Karina tells us that her mother Apolinaria has a small business called “Molino I” in which she sells candy at the market as a street vendor.

Karina has been selling beauty products for five years and her mother has been selling candy for two years. Both businesses have done very well. Karina is a hardworking and enterprising person who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strives every day to get ahead. She needs a loan to buy beauty products and to invest in her mother’s business. Karina dreams of studying at the San Antonio Abad National University of Cusco to earn a degree in biology. She also wants to study for a master’s degree in either molecular biology or biotechnology.

Karina is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Diamantes” (the Diamonds), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. This Communal Bank has been operating for 10 loan cycles. The members say they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, training classes, and the time they have spent as part of the Communal Bank. They are also grateful for this opportunity and promise to complete their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & invest in her mother's candy business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, tiene 63 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Su actividad económica principal es vender comestibles en un domicilio y su actividad complementaria es vender comida en la feria sabatina en el “Baratillo” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son  5 años que se dedica a  la venta de comestibles  y 25 años que vende en la feria. Juana es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario salir adelante, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y  cerveza. Su esposo trabaja como albañil pero no es permanente. Juana es una abuela muy buena pues actualmente se encuentra ayudando a su nieta Liz Ingrid. 
 
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, la socia manifiesta, que se encuentra contenta y satisfecha con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación y por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal y también se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.(En la fotografía la socia aparece acompañada de su nieta Ingrid).
texts.en:
Juana is 63 years old, married, and has seven children. Her main business is selling groceries from her home and she has a side business selling food at the Saturday fair held at “El Baratillo” (The Flea Market) in the city of Cusco. She has been selling groceries for 5 years and selling at the fair for 25 years. Juana is a hardworking and enterprising woman who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strives every day to get ahead. She needs a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, noodles, and beer. Her husband is a mason, but his work is not stable. Juana is a good grandmother and currently helps her granddaughter Liz Ingrid.

Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Diamantes” (the Diamonds), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. This Communal Bank has been operating for 10 loan cycles. The members say they are happy and satisfied with the loan services, savings, training classes, and the time they have spent as part of the Communal Bank. They are also grateful for this opportunity and promise to complete their payments on time. (In the photograph, Juana appears with her granddaughter Ingrid.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Ekua sells onions and palm fruits at Akotokyire. Her husband is a security man.  Ekua uses the income she acquires from her sales to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Ekua will add the loan to her original income to buy extra vegetables and palm fruits for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to buy extra vegetables and palm fruit for sale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 41 años, está casado con Susana de 33 años, tiene 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia, que se encuentra ubicado en la selva central del Perú. Él es un hombre emprendedor que busca sacar adelante a su familia, es por ello que hace 10 años, junto a su esposa e hijos, lo ayudan en el cultivo de frutas cítricas, mango y palta, sobre sus terrenos propios, a las que tanto ama, gracias a ello, pudo darles mejor beneficio a su familia y sobre todo solventar sin problemas sus gastos domésticos. Asimismo con las ganancias que le da esta actividad, logró construir su vivienda y hasta compró más terrenos agrícolas. Disfruta mucho lo que hace, es por ello que desea comprar más chacras, en donde pueda plantar frutas cítricas, que a futuro pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos. Este es segundo crédito con MFP, y está entusiasmado de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal, por estar integrado por personas muy unidas y empeñosas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 300 plantas de tangerina y 18 sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old and married to Susana, who is 33. They have four children and live in their own home, located in central Peruvian jungle. Luis is an enterprising man who looks to succeed on behalf of his family. For ten years he and his wife, along with their children, have been growing citrus fruits, mangoes, and avocados on their own land. Thanks to his work, Luis has been able to provide for his family and cover the household expenses without problems. With the earnings from this activity, he was able to build a house and buy more farmland. Luis enjoys his work tremendously and wants to buy more fields where he can plant citrus fruits in the future so that he can improve the quality of life for his children.

This is his second loan with MFP. Luis is excited about continuing his work with his Communal Bank because the members are very close and determined. With the requested loan, he will buy 300 tangerine plants and 18 sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 300 tangerine plants and 18 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es:
doña Marlene P. M. se dedica a la venta de tarjetas, recargas, sims, celulares y otros accesorios para celulares, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
Marlene esta soltera, es una mujer muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
vive con su mama y sus hermanas.
Marlene tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar recargas, tarjetas tiempo aire y sims para celulares.
las ganancias las necesita para ayudarle a su mama en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Marlene P. M. sells calling cards, rechargeable cards, SIM cards, cellular phones, and other phone accessories. She operates her business out of her home.

Marlene is a single hardworking woman who greatly desires to succeed. She lives with her mother and sisters. Marlene has been in this business for 10 years. The loan will be used to buy rechargeable cards that provide air time as well as SIM cards for cellular phones. She needs the income to help her mother with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rechargeable phone cards & cellular phone SIM cards

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 34 years old, and married with four children: three sons and one daughter. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for over 8 years.

She is a very hard working lady, and is involved in the decorative embroidery business. She gets orders from her neighbors and earns good profits. Her customers respect and trust her talent. They give her orders because they know that she will return the clothes on the set date. Her income allows her to share the financial burden of their family.
 
Her husband's name is A. A. and he operates a wood sales business in the community. He has twenty-five years of experience in this business.  
They both are uneducated but they want to raise their children with good educations, and as a result, their children are enrolled in a school and are getting a good education.
 
Farzana successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy wood in bulk to expand her husband’s wood sales business.

loans.use: To purchase wood to sell.

loans.name: Karina Margot

texts.es:
Karina tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos que son menores de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la venta ambulante de pan, ella ofrece su producto en una plaza bastante frecuentada de la ciudad de Chepén y ofrece su mercadería a los transeúntes que circulan por la zona, ella ofrece sus productos todos los dias muy temprano en la mañana y también por la tarde. Este negocio constituye una fuente importante de ayuda para la economía de su familia, por lo que ella trata de mantener su actividad con mucho esfuerzo.

El puesto de venta goza de buena acogida y Karina desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de embutidos, mantequillas y otros productos que acompañan el desayuno y el lonche (comida ligera tomada entre el almuerzo y la cena, suele consumirse entre las cinco y las siete de la noche).

Karina es una mujer emprendedora y que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia, su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien, ella es muy querida y estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, ellos la consideran una mujer de confianza y responsable.
texts.en:
Karina is 34 years old, married, and has two young children. She lives with her family in the District of Chepén, which is part of the province of the same name. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Karina has been selling bread as a street vendor for more than two years. She offers her products in a busy plaza in the city of Chepén to passersby who come through the area. Karina sells her products every day early in the morning and also in the afternoon. This business is an important source of income to her family, so she tries to maintain it with great effort.

Her vending post receives many customers, which is why she wants to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can offer more variety. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 400 PEN. She wants to buy sausages, butter, and other products that are served for breakfast and snacks (most people take a light meal between lunch and dinner, usually eaten between 5-7pm).

Karina is an enterprising woman who always looks after the welfare of her family. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and develop into good people. She is well-liked and respected by her neighbors and acquaintances, who consider her to be a trustworthy and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase butter, sausages, and other products to sell in addition to bread

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam is a wife of M. K. and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She has given birth to five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son reads in 8th standard, and the next eldest reads in 7th standard. The youngest two read in 4th standard. Her daughter reads in kindergarten.
 
Shabnam and her husband take care of their family and are trying to give their children a good future. Her husband sells construction supplies. He has 12 years of experience in this business, and has a good number of customers. His earnings allow him to meet the financial expenses and to pay for the education expenses of their kids.

Shabnam is applying for the first time to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) to purchase the construction supplies (cement and bricks) to expand her husband’s construction supplies business. She is a member of a group of four people.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Nazareth  se caracteriza porque esta integrado por personas que buscan la superación de su núcleo familiar así como también forman parte de comitivas que realizan proyectos en pro-desarrollo de la comunidad, los integrantes del grupo solidario Nazareth en su mayoría se dedican al comercio tales como venta de ropa, venta de granos básicos y venta de verduras. Dos de ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ganado.

Han solicitado un crédito en ASDIR para poder Recapitalizar sus negocios, solicitaron montos deacuerdo a su capacidad de pago. En el grupo se puede distinguir la cordialidad y la solidaridad para con cada uno de los integrantes. Son personas del área rural de Momostenango y que gracias al entusiasmo y optimismo han mejorado sus condiciones, cuentan con luz, agua potable, carreteras en buen estado, centros de Espiritualidad, escuelas, puesto de salud, lo ideal y necesario para conformar un grupo solidario.
texts.en:
The individuals that make up the Nazareth Solidarity Group are known for their desire to succeed on behalf of their families. They also participate in committees that oversee development projects in their community. The members of the Nazareth Solidarity Group are involved in businesses selling products such as clothing, basic grains, and vegetables. Two of the members engage in buying and selling livestock.

They have requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR so that they can recapitalize their businesses. The amounts they have requested are based on their ability to repay. This group has distinguished itself for its cordiality and the solidarity among each of the members. They are from the rural area of Momostenango and have improved their conditions thanks to their enthusiasm and optimism. Their community now has electricity, potable water, roads in good condition, spiritual centers, schools, and health clinics. The members have everything they need to form their solidarity group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Zahida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Zahida parveen is a 33 year old woman and resides in Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. She is a seamstress and offers her services in the community. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a good income. Her customers are very happy with her. She utilizes her income to pay for the utilities expenses.
