She is a mother of five children: one son and four daughters. All of her children are enrolled in school and are getting an education. Her husband's name is S. A., and he has a ready made garment sales business. He purchases the garments from different cities (Multan and Faisalabad) because of cheap prices and good quality. He has been in this business for over 12 years.
 
Zahida has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase more ready made garments to expand her husband’s business. She belongs to a group of four members.

loans.use: To purchase ready made garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for the production of jewelry and agricultural tools.

loans.name: Vilma Francisca

texts.es:
La socia Vilma; pertenece al banco comunal “CRUZ PATA”, Nuestra socia es natural D. Acomayo, ahora vive el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia del Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 52 años D. edad ella es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Nuestra socia alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia venD. granos (habas secas, pallares, frijoles, porotos, maíz en todas las variedades, trigo, quinua), en el mercado D. vino canchón y también se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa ella lleva a Huaypetue  las ropas para venderlas allá a una señora que le compra y a su vez lo venD.. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprare ropa y llevar hasta Huaypetue a vender. 

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. la deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This is Vilma. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Cruz Pata” and a native of Acomayo, but she now lives in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

Vilma is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Vilma sells dry goods (different types of dried beans, all varieties of corn, wheat, and quinoa) at the market in Vino Canchón. She also buys and sells clothing. The clothing she acquires is taken to a woman in Huaypetue who buys the clothing from her in order to sell. Vilma is requesting a loan to buy clothing to take with her to Huaypetue.

She values and appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Manuela De Jesus

texts.es: Manuela De Jesús tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, que tienen edades de 10 y 13 años y aun están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, entre lo que sobresale golosinas ubicada en casa de habitación. Algo que le ayuda a la señora es que ella trabaja en el hospital, y en ese lugar logra conseguir compradores que pueden ser a contado y a crédito, ya que son trabajadores del mismo local donde ella labora. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 18 años, ella empezó vendiendo en su casa de habitación gaseosas, refrescos y golosinas, cuando empezó a trabajar en el hospital ella observo que era viable traer mercadería de ropa y cosméticos para venderse en ese lugar con sus compañeros de trabajo. Este crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en de productos varios, ya que desea invertir en electrodomésticos y ropa. Ella sueña con establecer una distribuidora en el lugar que habita que brinde la manutención a ella y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuela de Jesús is 39 years old, married, and has two children ages 10 and 13 still in her care. She works selling general merchandise, including sweets, from her home. One helpful thing is that she works in the hospital where she has been able to get buyers both for cash and on credit, since they are workers in the same place where she works. She began this business 18 years ago when she began selling soft drinks, juice drinks, and sweets out of her house. When she began working in the hospital she noticed that it was possible to bring merchandise like clothing and cosmetics to sell there to her fellow workers. This loan requested by Manuela will be invested in various products since she wants to invest in electric appliances and clothing. Her dream is to establish a distribution outlet in her home that will provide for the maintenance of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anwari's Group

texts.en:
Anwari is married to M. A. and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her house consists of two rooms in which she lives with her two kids: one son and one daughter, and her husband. Her son reads in 4th standard and her daughter reads in 5th standard. Her husband is a tailor by profession and runs his own tailoring shop in the main market. His earnings support his family.

Anwari is also a very hard working lady. She operates her own handbags sales business, which she purchases from different places of Lahore named (Ichra and Anarkali) and then sells them in the community. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.

Anwari has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance insitutute in Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to purchase an electric sewing machine to expand her husband’s tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Martha Idalia

texts.es: Martha Idalia tiene 35 años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos a bajo su responsabilidad. Hace más 6 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general, Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para realizar este medio de vida. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de trajes, pantalones, camisetas, faldas y shorts. Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir de todos los granos básicos a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos a ella.
texts.en:
Martha Idalia is 35, married, and has three children for whom she is responsible. For over six months she has been selling general merchandise. She started this business because she needed income to support her family. Through all of her effort she was able to get her own capital. Her family gave her support to be able to make this way of life work. The loan will be used to buy dresses, pants, t-shirts, skirts, and shorts. Her wish is to have a mini mart, which she would be able to stock with all of the basic grains for the people who live close to her. That would provide her with greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, es un joven bastante laborioso, convive con Sabina, ella tiene dos hijos de su anterior compromiso, pero Milton los quiere como si fueran suyos, por el momento ambos no tienen hijos propios. Ellos viven juntos en su casa propia, construido de material noble. El asumir el rol de padre de familia, hizo que Milton ejerciera algún oficio, es así que decidió cultivar las tierras que le heredó su padre, en donde ya lleva 3 años, sembrando productos naturales de la zona, asimismo para que puedan solventar los gastos del hogar, tienen una pequeña bodega que juntos lo administran. Los días que no trabajo en las chacras, se va a laborar como jornalero, percibiendo S/.18.00 soles diarios, ganancia que le permite ahorrar. Mas adelante planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, para plantar palta y plátanos, así también desea abastecer su tienda con variados productos, para obtener más ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y está orgulloso de integrar a su grupo comunal, por ser un grupo bastante sólido y honesto que se preocupa por cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una refrigeradora que le permita vender gaseosa helada, chupete, entre otros productos necesarios, como especias y productos perecibles.
texts.en:
Milton is a very hard-working young man. He lives with Sabina, and she has two children from another relationship. But, Milton loves them as if they were his own. For now, they do not have their own children. They live together in their own house, which is made of humble material. Being a father made Milton decide to start a business. He decided to cultivate the land that he inherited from his father. He has been doing this for three years. He plants products that are native to the area. In order to be able to pay the household expenses, they have a small grocery store, which they run together. The days he does not work in the fields he goes to work as a day laborer. He gets 18 PEN a day, income that allows him to save. Later he plans to buy more agricultural land to plant avocados and bananas. He also wants to stock his store with various products in order to get more income. This is his third loan with MFP. He is proud of belonging to his communal bank because it is a very solid and honest group that cares about each one of its members. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a refrigerator. This will allow him to sell cold soft drinks and popsicles. He will also buy other needed products such as spices and perishable products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock his store

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
El joven Víctor S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 2 niños que están en edad escolar, Víctor S. trabaja como conductor en la Agencia de Envíos Jorge Salinas en la ciudad de León desde hace 8 años.
Trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2008, los créditos han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y para el mismo destino, solicito el segundo crédito, compra de ladrillos rojos, bolsas de cemento y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
El joven Víctor S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 2 niños que están en edad escolar, Víctor S. trabaja como conductor en la Agencia de Envíos Jorge Salinas en la ciudad de León desde hace 8 años. Trabaja con Ceprodel desde el año 2008, los créditos han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y para el mismo destino, solicito el segundo crédito, compra de ladrillos rojos, bolsas de cemento y pago de mano de obra.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para mejoramiento de Vivienda. (Ladrillos, Cemento y pago de mano de obra)

loans.name: Raheela's Group

texts.en:
Raheela is married to M. N. and lives in Lahore, in Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. Her husband works in a local factory, earning a monthly wage, and he also runs his own motorbike spare parts sales business. He opens his shop in the evening and generates an income. Raheela has given birth to two daughters and they are both not of school going age yet.

She has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to purchase spare parts to expand her husband’s spare parts sales business. She is part of a group of four members.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Fuerza Y Accion Group

texts.es:
Los socios de Alcancia Comunal Fuerza y acción se dedican a labores de, comercio y producción minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD hace varios años.
Lidia trabaja en el Mercado Central de Lima vende diferentes productos como: Cds, videos Dvd películas al por mayor y menor, con las  ganancias obtenidas puede aportar en casa además desea construir su vivienda para su mayor comodidad, los hijos apoyan a Lidia. 
Dionicia vende productos de belleza por catalogo, esto le ha permitido algunos beneficios ya que mediante las ventas recibe regalos, joyas, y productos del catalogo que ella lo puede vender y generar mayores ganancias para su familia.
Por las noches Marlene se dedica a la venta de comida  como: salchipapas, hamburguesas, pollo broaster, hace 1 año tiene un puesto propio, lugar donde es muy conocida, pero desea emprender un nuevo negocio de día. Con el préstamo otorgado comprara algunos insumos que le falta para sus ventas. Todo este esfuerzo es por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The members of the "Fuerza y Acción" (Force and Action) communal bank work in retail trade and production. They have worked with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD for several years. Lidia works in the Central Market of Lima selling different products such as cds, videos and dvds of films both wholesale and retail. With the profits she earns she can contribute at home. In addition she wants to build a home that is more comfortable. Her children support Lidia. Dionicia sells beauty products from a catalogue. This has given her some benefits as through the sales she receives gifts, jewelry, and products from the catalogue that she can sell and generate greater profits her family. In the evenings Marlene sells food such as: salchipapas (sausage and fries), hamburgers and broaster chicken. She has had her own stall for 1 year, a place which is very well known, but she wants to launch a new daytime business. With the loan she will buy some consumables that she needs for her sales. All this effort is for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José C. de 43 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, es soltero pero tiene dos hijas ya mayores de edad. Una de sus hijas vive con el y le ayuda en la casa mientras que el sale a trabajar.

José empezó con una mesa y una licuadora en las afueras de su casa haciendo jugos y batidos de frutilla, sandia y piña. Con la motivación de que el era el único sustento en su hogar decidió invertir sus ahorros y alquilar un local para su negocio. 

En la actualidad su negocio ha mejorado con mas mesas, sillas y también ha implementado dar desayunos con tostadas. Trabaja desde muy temprano preparando todo para sus clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar frutas como fustilla, mora, aguacate para su negocio de desayunos. 

En el futuro quiere mejorar su local para poder tener mas clientela y así asegurar su vejes con un buen negocio.
texts.en:
José Columbo is 43, and he lives in Paraiso de Guayaquil on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil. His is single, but he has two grown daughters. One of his daughters lives with him and helps him with the house while he goes to work. José started with a table and a blender outside of his house making juices and fruit shakes from watermelon and pineapple. Driven by the fact that he was the only source of income for the household, he decided to invest his savings and rent a place for his business. His business has now improved with tables and chairs. He has also started serving breakfast with tostadas. He starts working very early preparing everything for his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy fruit like strawberries, blackberries, and avocado for his breakfast business. In the future he wants to improve his place to be able to have more customers. He wants to make his old age secure with a good business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strawberries, avocados, and blackberries

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
After working fifteen years cleaning hotel rooms, Sarah had to undergo surgery to help remedy the carpal tunnel syndrome she had developed. At age 39, while recovering from her surgery, she knew she could not continue a life where she was unable to care for her husband, daughter and even herself. Sarah was determined to improve her own and her family’s quality of life and in January 2010, she opened up a child daycare center.

Sarah charged to her credit card $2000 worth of materials, toys, and decor and converted her living room into a children’s playland. Her current CDA (Child Development Associate) license allows her to take care of five children. As more parents have expressed interest in her services she has now applied for a CDA license that will allow her to take care of ten children. She has hired two part-time assistants and they are currently being reviewed for their CDA credentials.  

As her business continues to grow rapidly, Sarah came to ACCION USA for a microloan that would help her expand her daycare with more toys, puzzles, books, instruments, paints, and nap mats that could accommodate the children that are on her wait-list. She has calculated that once she is taking care of ten children she will be able to pay herself a full-time salary and as well as paying the two part-time assistants.

Sarah says she feels blessed to be a business owner, especially because it has allowed her time to dedicate to her daughter and husband. She feels a sense of accomplishment and credits ACCION USA for her even being able to open a business account. Her dream is to go back to school and eventually convert her childcare center into a pre-school.

loans.use: new staff and remodeling of daycare

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité Amanecer nace gracias al interés de varias señoras de formar un comité y tener así la posibilidad de acceder a un crédito; muchas de ellas ya tenían experiencia en comités por lo que en base a esa experiencia formaron uno.
Realizan actividades de tal forma a cumplir con todas las responsabilidades que toman  como organización como por  ejemplo para la ayuda solidaria a quienes atraviesan por dificultades dentro del comité.
Cada una de las integrantes maneja una actividad productiva que genere ingreso, así como la señora Celsa quien se dedica a a la venta de bebidas en general en local que posee en su domicilio. La atención del negocio lo realiza su marido y aprovecha la buena ganancia que deja este rubro por ello desea comprar en gran cantidad, y solicita el crédito para este fin. 
Todas las integrantes del comité agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya y la organización de  Kiva por la ayuda crediticia que ellos brindan.
texts.en:
The Amanecer committtee was born thanks to the interest some women had in forming a committee and thus have the possibility of accessing credit. Many of them already have experience in committees, so based on that experience they formed one. They undertake activities in such a way that they can carry out all the responsibilities that they take on as an organization. For example, the supportive help for those on the committee who go through hard times. Each of the members manages a productive activity that generates income. Mrs. Celsa sells general beverages in a locale she has in her home. Her husband attends to the business and she enjoys the good profit this activity leaves her. That is why she wants to buy in greater quatities, and she is asking for the loan for that purpose. All of the members of the committee thank the Fundación Paraguaya and the Kiva organization for the credit help that they offer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general beverages such as: soda, wine, beer, and all types of liquor

loans.name: July

texts.es: LA SEÑORITA JULY ES SOLTERA, ESTUDIANTE, TIENE SU TIENDITA DE BARRIO DONDE OFRECE PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD Y TAMBIEN REGALOS,  LA CUAL LE PERTENECIA A SU MAMA, CUANDO SU MAMA SALIA ELLA SE QUEDABA ATENDIENDO LA TIENDA  DESDE PEQUEÑA LUEGO SE PUSO A ESTUDIAR ADMINISTRACION DE EMPRESAS, CUANDO TENIA TIEMPO LIBRE SE HACIA CARGO DE SU TIENDA, AHORA ESTA TRABAJANDO EN EL CAFETAL COMO ASISTENTE DE GERENCIA. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO ES PARA EQUIPAR MAS SU TIENDITA COMPRO BOLOS SON HELADOS DE AGUA SIN LECHE YA QUE SON NOVEDOSOS EN ESPECIAL PARA LOS NIÑOS Y LLAMA LA ATENCION  YA QUE SON MUY RICAS Y  APETESIBLES, LA SRTA. ES UN AJOVENCITA TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
July is single and a student. She has a local store which belongs to her mother where she sells basic consumables and also gifts. Whenever her mother went out she looked after the store from when she was young. Later on she started studying business administration, and when she has free time she takes care of her store. Now she is working in a coffee plantation as management assistant. The loan money is to re-stock her store. She bought "bolos" - they are milkless ice blocks - as they are novelties especially for children and they get their attention since they are very rich and appetizing. She is a hard working and responsible young woman and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given by awarding the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora  Francisca González es madre soltera de 3 hijos todos mayores de edad; ella posee un modesto local de venta de comida en el mercado de San Lorenzo  desde hace 20 años , sale todas  las mañanas bien temprano de su domicilio para preparar desayuno, media mañana y almuerzo.
Francisca  tiene una buena clientela  formada quienes recurren en forma permanente al local para adquirir los productos elaborados por la señora Francisca y por ello necesita de este crédito para ampliar su local.  
Con este trabajo mantiene  su hogar  y pudo sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca González is a single mother of three children who are all adults. For 20 years, she has had a modest locale where she sells food in the San Lorenzo market. She leaves her home very early every morning to prepare breakfast, mid morning meal, and lunch. Francisca has good clientele made up of people who always go to the locale to acquire the products prepared by Francisca. That is why she needs this loan to make her locale bigger. With this job, she supports her home and she has been able to get her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay the labor and material costs for construction

loans.name: Ruth Y Esther 1 Group

texts.en:
R. is the coordinator of her group Ruth Y Esther (Ruth and Esther), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsuL., a lush, rugged area with a nascent tourism industry where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure as a single mother with two children.

R. is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling assorted items in the street including, balloons, candy, mints, etc. She will use the profits for her children and family by purchasing medicine and school supplies, and towards saving to construct her own home. She hopes also to continue saving with Esperanza so that she can have a cushion when she can't work anymore She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy balloons, gum, and candy to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio tiene 46años. El es propietario de un taller mecánico ubicado en su propio domicilio. Trabaja en este negocio desde el año 2001.
Además cuenta con un vehículo tipo colectivo, el cual emplea en una línea de transporte publico como chofer independiente.
 El Sr. Julio se inicio desde muy joven trabajando en talleres mecánicos donde pudo adquirir sus conocimientos.
El necesita de este crédito para adquirir repuestos de camiones de gran porte, pues obtuvo un buen trabajo de mantenimiento de un lote de camiones, lo que le permitirá generar un ingreso considerable. 
En el futuro desea comprar otro vehículo tipo colectivo y ampliar el local de su taller mecánico para brindar mas fuente de trabajo a otras personas que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Julio is 46 years old. He is the owner of a mechanic's workshop located in at own home. He has been working at this business since the year 2001. He also has a public transportation vehicle. He uses it in a public transportation line as an independent driver. Julio started working in mechanic's workshops when he was very young, and in this was was able to acquire his knowledge. He needs this credit to acquire parts for a large truck. He obtained a good maintenance job in a truck lot, which allows him to generate considerable income. In the future, he wishes to purchase another transportation vehicle and enlarge the mechanic's workshop in order to offer a source of employment to people who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts for large trucks

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda Isabel tiene 53 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de frutas y verduras. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, sus inicios se dan por no tenia los recursos suficientes para mantener a sus hijos, ya que por medio de la venta de plátanos lo obtuvo, pues todos los días se dedicaba a ofrecer un buen servicio. Por lo que está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como plátanos, repollo, papa, cebolla y ayote. Ella sueña con tener una pulpería muy grande.
texts.en:
Yolanda Isabel, age 53, sells fruits and vegetables. She has worked in this business for over 18 years. She started because she did not have enough resources to support her children. She got them by selling bananas. She works everyday offering good service. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material like bananas, cabbage, potatoes, onions, and squash. She dreams of having a very large mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: El Arroyo Unido 1,2,5 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group El Arroyo Unido (United Stream), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner.

Altagracia is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing, by purchasing blouses, pants, shirts, and shoes in the main market in Santo Domingo (the capital) and then selling them at a profit in her community. She will use the profits to invest in basic needs such as food and medicine, as well as to pay for her university education and a computer for learning. Her long term goal is to be a lawyer. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, shirts and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 30 años, se le caracteriza por ser muy alegre y perseverante, está casada con Ethel de 37 años y juntos viven con sus 3 hijos en su propio domicilio. Lo que más le agrada, es cuidar de sus frutos, pues cada producto representa un esfuerzo recompensado, es por eso que lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad, que es la agricultura. Por otro lado, Mónica y su esposo instalaron una tienda de comestibles, una manera de generarse  utilidades adicionales, de esta manera, ambos se concentran en estas dos fuentes de ingresos. En sus tiempos libres trabaja en una hacienda como tractorista, de donde percibe cada quincena la suma de S/. 400.00 soles. Por tanto, con estás actividades, puede educar a sus hijos y sobre todo brindarles una vida cómoda, es por ello que desea plantar en más hectáreas, frutas cítricas y paltas, de igual manera desea incrementar con productos su tienda, y asegurar sus ventas. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo banco comunal, porque siempre cuenta con la ayuda de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos comestibles para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mónica is 30 years old, and she is known for her cheerfulness and perseverance. She is married to Ethel, age 37, and together they live in their own home with their 3 children. What she enjoys most is taking care of her fruit orchards, since every product she sells represents compensation for her efforts. This is why she has spent 5 years doing this agricultural work. At the same time, Monica and her husband have also opened a grocery store, which provides a way for them to generate additional profits. Thus, both of them concentrate on these two sources of income. In her free time, Mónica also works on a large farm as a tractor driver, for which she receives the sum of 400 Peruvian soles every two weeks. Thanks to all of this work, Mónica is able to educate her children and above all to provide them with a comfortable life. Toward this aim, she wants to plant more hectares with citrus fruits and avocados, and she would also like to expand the stock of products at her store to ensure a good level of sales. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she says she enjoys working with her communal bank group, because she can always count on help from her fellow members. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy food products to increase the stock at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various products to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes tiene la edad de 29 años, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación.  María tiene 3 hijos todos están a su cargo. Tiene la actividad económica de la venta de ropa y calzado. Dio inicio a este negocio de una manera muy humilde, ya que tenía muy poco capital para comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le habían solicitado. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esto la conlleva a solicitar este financiamiento para la compra de atería prima. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 29 years old. She has spent a lot of time working with Fundación. María cares for three children.

Her business is the sale of clothing and footwear. She began the business very simply because she had very little capital to purchase all the products that her customers wanted from her. She has been involved in the business more than 11 years. She is applying for the loan in order to purchase inventory. Her wish is to maintain the value of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jesus Nuestra Esperanza 3 Group

texts.en:
Binet is the coordinator of her group Jesus Nuestra Esperanza (Jesus is our hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a city on the North Coast of the DR, with an economy based around tourism, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their four children.

Binet is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business creating curtains, by purchasing the materials she needs to create them such as fabric, decorations and thread. She will use the profits to invest in her home by installing a concrete floor, a major improvement in an area where rains often turn mud floors into unsanitary cesspools. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy material for making curtains and bed covers.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando con mucho entusiasmos, superando todos los obstáculos que se les presente. Todas se encuentran con muchos deseos de superarse  y mejorar la actividad que caD. una realiza.
Diferentes actividades son desarrolladas por las integrantes del comité, una de ellas es la señora Leticia quien se dedica como vendedora de productos variados dependiendo de la época, clima o cualquier otra situación especial que se presente. Pensando en la época fría que esta comenzando quiere adquirir todo tipo de prendas para inviernos, para este fin ha solicitado el préstamo.
texts.en:
This community bank is working with great enthusiasm, overcoming all the obstacles that they meet. All have a great desire to set their sights higher and improve their respective businesses.

The members of the community bank have developed different business activities. One of the members is Señora Leticia, who sells various products depending on the season, the weather, or whatever other special situation turns up. Thinking of the cold season that is beginning, she wants to acquire all types of garments for winter, and for this reason she is applying for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various article to sell, such as winter socks, pants, scarves, gloves, shoes, and lingerie in general

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Con Propositos Group

texts.en:
Aurelinda is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Unidas Con Propositas (Women United with Purposes), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a city famous for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner.

Aurelinda is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She makes curtains in her business. By purchasing a sewing machine and purchasing more fabric, her business will grow. She will use the profits to invest in growing her business to be a full fledged production center with several employees. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Fabric, sewing machine

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio tiene 46 años, convive con Rosa de 40 años, y juntos viven con sus dos hijos, en su domicilio propio, ubicado en una zona céntrica de la selva peruana. Del cuidado adecuado que le brinda a sus productos, obtiene frutos de calidad, es por eso que dedica con esmero sus cultivos y los protege de las plagas y de las variaciones climáticas, es así que ha llevado 10 años cosechando frutas cítricas, plátanos y palta, en donde recibe la ayuda de su pareja cuando es época de recolección. Lo que le disgusta a Nemesio es que no consideren el valor de sus productos, al contario, el hace prevalecer el precio justo ante los mayoristas, es por ello que considera que su trabajo le es rentable. De las ganancias que obtiene planea comprarse 5 hectáreas de terreno para producir yuca y naranjas, y de las rentas que le proporcionarán, podrá construir una casa en la ciudad en donde desea instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y le entusiasma la idea de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal, por ser puntuales y unidos. El crédito que solicita, será para comprarse un par de reses, ya que desea intensificarse en la ganadería.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 46 years old. He lives with Rosa, who is 40, and their two children in their own house, located in a central zone of the Peruvian forest. With the proper care that he gives to his products, he obtains quality fruits, and for this reason he cultivates them with painstaking care and protects them from pests and variations in the weather. Thus he has spent 10 years harvesting citrus fruits, bananas, and avocados; he receives the help of his partner during harvest season. What upsets Nemesio is that they don't respect the value of his products; on the contrary, he has to establish a fair price with the wholesalers. For this reason, he considers his work profitable.

From the earnings that he obtains, he plans to buy 5 hectares of land to produce yucca and oranges, and from the income that they will provide, he will build a house in the city, where he wants to set up a business to sell food.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he is enthusiastic about the idea of continuing to work with his community group, because they are punctual and united. The loan he applying for will be used to purchase a pair of cattle, since he wants to increase his livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two cattle

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María Santos tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el sector Fundo el Médano, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Lambayeque, ubicado a la altura del kilometro 5 de la carretera Chiclayo – Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes, frutas, verduras y demás productos de uso diario en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, el negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la ubicación de la zona, que está bastante alejada tanto de la ciudad de Lambayeque como de Chiclayo, por lo que agenciarse de productos de primera necesidad es bastante complicado.

María trata de brindarle a sus clientes productos frescos, por ello viaja a la ciudad de Chiclayo dos veces por semana para comprar carnes y verduras frescas en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista) esto ha hecho que su negocio vaya creciendo durante el tiempo que lleva funcionando. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y para ayudar a sostener a su familia.

Maria Santos desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. María ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución ya demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the "Fundo el Médano" sector, in the rural area of the Lambayeque district, located 5 kilometers above the Chiclayo – Lambayeque road. For the past year she's been selling basic need items, groceries, fruit, vegetables, and other daily use products. She runs her small store out of her home. Her business does very well, given the zone's location, which is located far from the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo. The distance also makes products sales complicated. María tries to bring her customers fresh products, so she travels to the city of Chiclayo two times per week to buy meats and vegetables in the Moshoqueque market (the main marketplace). This has allowed her business to grow. She uses the income for personal expenses and to help support her family. María would like to expand her business by buying more products in order to be able to satisfy her customers' needs. She has requested this 1,000 PEN ($350) loan through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her objective. She is a hard working woman, dedicated to her family. Her greatest desire is to continue to work to provide a better quality of life for her family. María has worked with our institution in the past and she has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

location.town: Fundo El Médano, Carretera Chiclayo - Lambayeque,

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
La señora Wilma  C. C. es casada tiene 41 años de edad, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 3 hijos. Wilma vive con su esposo, tienen su vivienda en la zona de Itocta de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Wilma y su esposo se dedican a la producción de leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero de la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte de PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, su vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Wilma es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella su esposo y sus hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado de las mimas, actividad en la que participa toda la familia. 
  
La señora WILMA solicita el crédito para la adquisición de alimento en general, ya que en la época de invierno este escasea y sube considerablemente de precio. Así mismo pueda mantener la producción de leche de manera que no bajen sus ingresos y estos se mantengan estables. El ideal que tiene la señora Wilma es que por lo menos todos sus hijos terminen la colegiatura la colegiatura y posteriormente alcanzar alguna profesión.
texts.en:
Wilma is married and has three children. She is 41 years old and has an elementary school education. She and her husband live in the Itocta zone in the Cercado province within the Cochabamba department. Wilma and her husband have dairy cows and deliver their entire production to a milk company within their zone, for later pickup by Pil Andina. They live in modest conditions. Her home includes the basic services and they raise their livestock on the same property. Wilma is very dedicated to her work. She, her husband, and children rise very early each day to milk the cows and spend the rest of the day caring for them. She is asking for this loan in order to buy feed, because the price goes up considerably over the winter. By doing this, she will be able to maintain her income at the current level. He hopes that her children will be able to obtain college educations and become successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle Feed

loans.name: Hilda Irma

texts.es:
La señora Hilda Irma  R. D. S. es una señora con 40 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel D. primario, tiene 3 hijos. Hilda Irma vive sola pues su esposo viajo a Argentina hace más D. 10 años en busca D. mejores oportunidades pero después D. algunos meses dejo D. llamarlos y D. mandarles remesas. La señora Hilda Irma vive en la zona D. Itocta provincia Cercado del departamento D. Cochabamba.

La señora Hilda Irma se dedica a la producción D. leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero D. la zona, para su posterior recojo por parte D. la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son modestas, tienen una casa con habitaciones pequeñas hechas D. barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Hilda Irma  es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y sus hijos se levantan muy temprano todos los días para orD.ñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican al cuidado D. las mismas, toda vez que el ganado lechero requiere bastante atención.  
 
La señora Hilda Irma solicita el crédito para poder comprar alimento en general, pues en la época D. invierno este escasea bastante, D. tal manera tenga la producción asegurada durante esta época y así mantener sus ingresos. El ideal que tiene la señora Hilda Irma es que por lo menos todos sus hijos terminen la colegiatura. Hilda Irma desearía que sus hijos logren estudiar una carrera técnica para ello es que trabaja con mucho entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Hilda Irma R. D. S. is 40 years old. She just went to school at the primary level. She has three children. Hilda lives alone because her husband traveled to Argentina over ten years ago looking for better opportunities. After a few months he stopped calling them and stopped sending money. Hilda Irma lives in the area of the Ictocta province near the Cochabamba department. Hilda Irma devotes herself to the production of raw milk. She delivers all of her milk production to a cooperative in the area. It is later collected by PIL ANDINA, a dairy factory. Their living conditions are modest. They have a house with small rooms maD. of adobe. She raises her livestock on the same property. Hilda Irma is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She and her children get up very early everyday to milk the cows. They take care of the cows all day. Dairy cows require plenty of attention. Hilda Irma is requesting the loan to be able to buy food. During the winter season it is pretty scarce. That way she will have an assured production during this season and maintain her income. Hilda Irma’s goal is for all of her children to at least finish high school. Hilda Irma wants her children to study for a technical career so that they can work with a lot of enthusiasm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La señora Primitiva H. C., cuenta con 65 años, apenas estudio hasta el nivel de primario, tiene 1 hija. Primitiva vive sola con su hija. La señora Primitiva vive en la zona de Itocta provincia Cercado del Departamento de Cochabamba.

La señora Primitiva se dedica exclusivamente a la producción de leche cruda, toda su producción lechera entrega a un modulo lechero de la zona, que a su vez recoge la empresa PIL ANDINA. 

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy precarias, tienen una casa con habitaciones pequeñas hechas de barro, su ganado se cría en la misma propiedad. La señora Primitiva es una señora muy dedicada a su trabajo, pues ella y su hija se levantan muy temprano todos los días para ordeñar las vacas. Y durante todo el día se dedican a pastear a las vacas, es una actividad ardua donde ambos trabajan.   

La señora Primitiva solicita el crédito para la compra de alimento en general que en la época de invierno este escasea bastante, de esta manera pueda producir más leche, e incrementar  sus ingresos y tener una nivel de vida estable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Primitiva H. C. is 65 years old and has one daughter. She only completed primary school. Primitiva lives with her daughter in the Itocta zone in the province of Cercado in the department of Cochabamba. Primitivia works in raw milk production. She delivers her milk to a local dairy producer who then delivers the milk to Pil Andina. They live in precarious conditions. Their house has small rooms made from clay. Her dairy cows live on the same small property. Mrs. Primitiva is very dedicated to her work. She and her daughter wake up early every day to milk their cows and then during the day they make sure their cows get to graze. This work can be quite arduous for both of them. Primitiva will use the loan money to purchase animal feed because during the winter there is limited food. With feed the cows will produce more milk and thus increase her earnings and let her have a more stable life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Cañaberal Group

texts.es:
El comité Cañaveral nace hace cerca de 6 meses, mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encuentra trabajando también en la zona. 
Varias señoras se unieron y decidieron formar un nuevo comité en el barrio están de manera exitosa hasta el momento.
Ellas  además de trabajar de forma independiente, tienen un fondo común que lograron mediante el trabajo conjunto entre las integrantes.
Una de ellas es la señora María quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios fabricados con hilos de crochet; como sobrecamas y manteles para mesas, todos fabricados por ella.
Solicita el préstamos para algunos gastos familiares y para la compra de materiales de trabajo como hilos de varios tipos.
texts.en:
The Cañaveral committee was created about six months ago due to the efforts of another committee that works in the area. Several women met and decided to form a new committee in their neighborhood and are have had success since starting. As well as working independently, they have a common fund which they have funded through working together. One of them is Maria who works selling crochet products like bedspreads and tablecloths which she hand stitches. They are applying for the loan to cover family expenses and the purchase of work materials, namely various kinds of thread.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool thread, other threads, and family expenses

loans.name: Xiomara Carina

texts.es: Xiomara Carina tiene 32 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella dio inicio con fondos propios, con el asesoramiento de sus compañeras de trabajo empezó dando créditos, a trabajadores del centro escolar donde ella laboraba, así fue que empezó a obtener sus propios clientes, por lo que las facilidades de pago son quincenales y es mucho más favorables para sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de pintura de uña, pintura de labios, vanidad y ropa interior. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda y establecer su propia tienda de cosméticos y ropa.
texts.en:
Xiomara Carina is 32 years old, and she works selling cosmetics. She started her business with her own money and with advice from her co-workers she started selling products on credit to other workers at the school where she works. She started to gain clients allowing them to make payments ever 15 days, which her clients see as favorable terms. The loan that she is currently seeking will be used to buy fingernail polish, lipstick, and underwear. Her goal is to finish building her home and open her own cosmetics and clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 49 años, es separara desde hace 20 años, y de cuyo compromiso tuvo dos hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa que es propia. Para ella, cada tiempo que pasa es una lucha constante para salir adelante sin importar las adversidades se le presentan. Es así que hace 30 años, que se dedica a sembrar maíz, alfalfa, avena y flores de diferentes variedades, en sus terrenos. Además se dedica también a la crianza de dos vacas, de las que extrae a diario 15 litros de leche, y que luego son vendidos entre sus conocidos.  A veces recibe la ayuda de su hijo menor pero casi siempre labora sola, gracias a ello, puede vivir cómodamente, por tanto espera comprar cuatro chacras más ubicadas en frente de su casa, para poder cuidarlos de cerca, disfrutando además, de cortar el pasto y oler la fragancia del campo verde. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y asegura que le permitirá progresar, ya que lo invertirá muy bien. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará alimentos balanceados para sus vacas y 3 sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Irene is 49 years old and has been separated for 20 years. She has two children, one of whom lives with her in her house. For Irene every day is a a constant battle to improve no matter what adversity she faces. For 30 years she has worked growing corn, alfalfa, oats, and various kinds of flowers on her land. She also raises two cows that give her 15 liters of milk a day, which she sells to acquaintances. Sometimes she gets help from her youngest son, but she normally works alone. Thanks to her work she can live comfortably, and she has been able to buy four more pieces of farmland in front of her house. This makes it easy to care for her land and she can enjoy the freshly cut grass and the smells of the green countryside. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with them and investing her loan money well. With this loan she will buy feed for her cows and three bags of organic fertilizer to spread over her crops to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: working capital to buy grocery items and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: BUYING MATERIALS, SUPPLIES, AND TOOLS FOR THEIR BUSINESSES

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Pahuichi Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal “PAHUICHI” esta conformado por 11 miembros y representado por el señor Juan Oscar, este grupo esta conformado por socios jóvenes con ganas de salir adelante y crecer en sus negocios.  El señor Juan Oscar es Soltero el acaba de terminar de estudia Odontología y desea poder montar su propio consultorio y hacer una especialidad, es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para tener sus consultorio y poder trabajar y pagar sus estudios por las noches. El resto de los socios se dedican diferentes actividades como la elaboración y venta de masitas, venta de cosméticos y ropa mediante catalogo, libros, cds, atención en licorería y  otros son publicista pese a lo jóvenes que son. A  pesar de que la competencia dentro de cualquier actividad de comercio que se realice, está muy fuerte, los clientes saben por donde moverse, como realizar los contactos y cuales son las fechas adecuadas para cada producto en otras palabras tienen mucha experiencia. Los socios sutilizaran el crédito para la compra de libros de especialidad, otros para la compra de mercadería, la publicista para la compra de una cámara filmadora. La mayor expectativa que tiene este grupo de jóvenes es poder culminar sus estudios porque muchos se encuentran a mitad de sus carreras debido a que la mayoría se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para sustentarse. Varios de estos clientes ya trabajaron con otras instituciones del sistema financiero, como también algunos ya trabajaron en nuestra institución, es en este sentido que a pesar de ser jóvenes quieren salir adelante para crecer mas y ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
The “PAHUICHI” communal bank includes 11 members and is represented by Juan Oscar. This group is made up of young members who have the desire to get ahead and expand their businesses. Juan Oscar is single, and he has just finished his studies in the field of Odontology. He wants to open his own clinic and also continue specialized studies. He needs the loan in order to open his clinic, so he can work and pay for his night classes. The other members work in a range of fields, such as making and selling pastries; selling cosmetics and clothing from a catalog; selling books or CDs; or serving customers in a liquor store. Others work in public relations, in spite of their young age. Despite the fact that there is heavy competition in all of these fields, the members know where to go, how to make contacts, and what seasons are best for each product; in short, they have a lot of experience. Some of the members will use the loan to buy specialized books; others will buy merchandise; and the publicist will use it for a video recorder. The greatest expectation shared by this group of young people is to be able to finish their studies, because many of them are working full-time in their careers due to their need to support themselves. Some of these members have worked in the past with other financial institutions, and some have worked with our institution in the past. In spite of being young, they want to get ahead, expand their businesses and become better every day.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria Esperanza tiene la actividad  económica de brindar el servicio de transporte. Ella inicia este negocio por su esposo ya que anteriormente era él quien se hacía cargo, pero debido a su edad no ha pudo seguir adelante pero Maria con sus 2 hijas lograron hacerse cargo del negocio, ya que tienen la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante salir adelante ya que a su edad es muy difícil obtener un trabajo estable a pesar de las dificultades que enfrenta como es el descuido de parte de los usuarios con su vehículo. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo destinado para la inversión como es mejora del vehículo, soldaduras y reparaciones del camastro. Ella sueña con lograr comprar otra unidad.
texts.en:
Maria Esperanza makes a living providing transportation services. Maria’s husband started this business and was previously in charge of it, but because of his age he was no longer able to get ahead. Maria took over the business with help from her 2 daughters because they needed to pay the household expenses. Getting ahead is very important to her, but at her age it is very difficult to get a stable job due to the difficulties that she faces such as her customers not taking proper care of her vehicle. She is asking for this loan for working capital, which she will invest in making improvements on the vehicle, including welding and repairing the bed of the vehicle. Her dream is to be able to purchase another vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for making improvements on her vehicle

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 30 años, está casada con Samuel de 37 años, ambos tienen un pequeño hijo Eduardo, y juntos viven en una casa alquilada, lugar donde instaló una bodega para tener una fuente adicional de ingresos económicos paralelo a la agricultura. Su tienda es una de las preferidas de su localidad, por estar ubicada cerca de una institución educativa. Es así que lleva 5 años trabajando en la venta de comestibles, por lo que todas las mañanas es la primera en abrir su establecimiento y también es la ultima en cerrarla. Paralelo a ello, se dedica a cultivar frutas cítricas, café, palta y plátanos, y cuando es temporada de cosecha, su esposo la ayuda. En el futuro espera construir su propia casa, en un terreno que compró recientemente en la ciudad, de esa manera pueda brindarle comodidad a su familia, asimismo desea incrementar su producción de café, por ser muy rentable la venta de este producto. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, por estar conformado por personas responsables que buscan su progreso a base de trabajo constante.  Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 250 plantas de café para plantarlos en un terreno que le heredó su padre.
texts.en:
Raquel is 30 years old and is married to Samuel, who is 37. They have a small son, Eduardo, and they all live together in a rented home, a place where they have installed a store in order to have an additional source of income along with the income they earn from agriculture. Her store is a favorite in her area, because it is located near an educational institution. She has been working in this way selling food products for 5 years; every morning she is the first to open her establishment, and she is also the last to close. In addition to this, she cultivates citrus fruit, coffee, avocado and bananas. When it is harvest time, her husband helps her. In the future she hopes to build her own house on a piece of land that she bought recently in the city. In this way she can provide comfort to her family. In addition she wants to increase her production of coffee, because the sale of this product is very profitable. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she likes working with her communal bank, which is comprised of responsible people who seek their progress based on hard work. With the loan she requests, she will buy 250 coffee plants to plant on the land that she inherited from her father.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tp buy 250 coffee plants

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 63 años D. edad, es soltera y vive en el sector Campodónico D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, conocida a nivel nacional como La Ciudad D. la Amistad, se caracteriza por su abundante movimiento comercial y D. transporte, es la capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace mas D. cinco años a la elaboración y comercialización D. todo tipo D. pasteles y tortas, ella prepara sus productos en su vivienda y los distribuye a los diversos comerciantes que trabajan en los principales centros D. abasto D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, como mercados y centros comerciales, ellos venden sus pasteles por porciones al publico en general. Adicionalmente Flor también prepara sus productos para compromisos sociales como cumpleaños. Matrimonios, entre otros. 

Flor se ha ido haciendo conocida y poco a poco su numero D. pedidos va creciendo, por ello se ha planteado ampliar su producción para lo que necesita mas materiales e insumos, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el logro D. su objetivo.

Flor es una mujer trabajadora y que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, sus clientes y conocidos le consideran alguien responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Flor is 63 years old, single, and lives in the Campodónico neighborhood of the city of Chiclayo, known at the national level as the City of Friendship. The city is characterized by its large commercial and transportation sectors. It is the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than 5 years Flor has been making and selling all types of cakes and pastries. She prepares the products in her home and distributes them to various merchants who work in the main retail centers of the city of Chiclayo, such as markets and shopping malls. They sell her cakes by the slice to the general public. In addition, Flo prepares her products for social occasions such as birthdays, weddings, and other occasions. Flor has become well-known and gradually her orders are increasing. For this reason she is planning to increase her production. To do this she needs more materials and supplies, so she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles that she will invest to achieve this objective. Flor is a hardworking woman who likes the work that she does very much. Her customers and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies to expand her cake business
